story:
Short Summary


MoorUs is the first social networking app that is centered around the empowerment  of people of global African descent. MoorUs will allow like-minded people to connect with each other for :

*daily dialog

*business endeavors

*educational purposes

*dating

*sharing current events

*photo and video sharing

*and much more


MoorUs was conceived by the same producers who created the popular Hidden Colors documentary film series. The Hidden Colors series emphasizes the importance of global Black empowerment, so the MoorUs app will act as a daily extension of this mission.

What We Need & What You Get

The app is currently in development, and the additional funding here will help cover marketing and promotions. There are a lot of great perks for those who contribute to this ground breaking project. 

The Impact

The MoorUs app is important because there should be a central location where people who wish to participate in constructive dialog can link up without being banned or censored-which is something that happens with many other social networking sites. 

Risks & Challenges

The greatest challenge was brainstorming with our team of developers in order to come up with ways to integrate live widgets on that app that could help users locate Black businesses in their local area in real time. We have resolved that challenge as well as other technical challenges,and we feel the app will exceed the expectations of the users.
story_txt:
Short Summary 
  MoorUs is the first social networking app that is centered around the empowerment  of people of global African descent. MoorUs will allow like-minded people to connect with each other for :
*daily dialog
*business endeavors
*educational purposes
*dating
*sharing current events
*photo and video sharing
*and much more

MoorUs was conceived by the same producers who created the popular Hidden Colors documentary film series. The Hidden Colors series emphasizes the importance of global Black empowerment, so the MoorUs app will act as a daily extension of this mission.
What We Need & What You Get
 The app is currently in development, and the additional funding here will help cover marketing and promotions. There are a lot of great perks for those who contribute to this ground breaking project. 
    The Impact The MoorUs app is important because there should be a central location where people who wish to participate in constructive dialog can link up without being banned or censored-which is something that happens with many other social networking sites. 
    Risks & Challenges The greatest challenge was brainstorming with our team of developers in order to come up with ways to integrate live widgets on that app that could help users locate Black businesses in their local area in real time. We have resolved that challenge as well as other technical challenges,and we feel the app will exceed the expectations of the users.

story:
日本語の翻訳版

 

When it comes to computing on the go, it’s difficult to find the perfect device…

Laptops have lots of processing power and plentiful applications, but they are bulky and difficult to travel with. Tablets are portable and versatile, but they lack the convenience of a keyboard and only support limited software. 

That’s why we made Falcon - a portable, powerful, and functional 2-in-1, 8-inch laptop. It combines the best benefits of both laptops and tablets with advanced features and an affordable price. 

 

 

  •  Easy to Use, Easy to Carry

Falcon’s 8 inch size strikes the perfect balance between performance and portability. It has a gorgeous IPS capacitive touch screen and a comfortable, ergonomic keyboard that makes work a breeze. When it’s time to move, Falcon folds into a compact tablet that is lightweight and easy to carry. 

 

  •  Laptop Mode 

Falcon has two modes to perfectly suit any situation. Its laptop mode is for times when power and performance are essential. It features a backlit keyboard that is large enough for comfortable and effective work or communications, an OFN mouse for precision and convenience, and a capacitive touchscreen for quick access to programs and gaming.  

 

  •  Tablet Mode

Falcon can be easily transformed into a tablet. After closing the keyboard, it locks automatically for one-handed touchscreen control that makes reading, gaming and note-taking more comfortable and effective at home, office, or on the go. 

 

  • Big on Power

Falcon runs on a powerful Intel® Pentium® Silver N5000 quad-core processor, enough processing power for virtually any typical application. It also features 8GB RAM and up to 256GB SSD storage for files, music and video, and a 1920 x 1200 resolution Corning Gorilla Glass touchscreen. It operates on the reliable Windows 10 Home system and Ubuntu.

 

  • Small in Size

Falcon weighs only 1.5 lbs – compact enough to easily fit in your bag. It can be held with one hand and is perfect for home, travel, work and everyday tasks.

 

  • Ports

Though small in size, Falcon is packed with ports to give you the ultimate in connectivity. It features one USB Type-C port, one USB Type-A port, an HDMI port, and a 3.5mm headphone jack. The Type-C port can be used for both charging and expansion.

 

  • Battery Life

Active lifestyles require plenty of power! Power-hungry full size laptops often can’t get you through the day but Falcon’s battery has enough capacity to power your fun and games for up to 8 hours. 

 

  • Falcon Pen

Falcon pen uses 1024 Levels of Pressure Sensitivity. It provides high sensitivity and precise writing & graphic arts control. It is the perfect addition when pin-point accuracy is required for high level tasks, graphic design and art.

 

  • Active Cooling | G-Sensor | Backlit Keyboard | OFN Mouse 

Falcon has the convenience of a tablet with the features of a laptop including G-Sensor for movement control, Backlit Keyboard for ease of use, an OFN mouse for track point control, and Active Cooling (don’t worry you can turn off the fan for a quieter mode if you choose). With Falcon, you have all the power and performance you need. 

 

  • Outstanding Design

Uni-body design and precision machined aluminum-magnesium case for strength and a sleek look. 

 

  •  Falcon Gaming Demo by Liliputing
  • Falcon Linux Text by Liliputing

story:
The Esington Glass is a powerful motivating force in a simple, elegant and beautiful package. 

Esington Glass productivity timers are filled with beautiful black sand. These make the glasses unique and give them a spectacular visual effect.

Hand blown artisan glass

A 1/2 scale prototype being hand blown at the factory

Each Esington Glass is hand blown from a single piece of glass making each vessel unique. They are then quality checked for finish and filled by hand for accurate timing.

“Congrats on the success of the Esington Glass! I'm a fan of the beautiful design and it's simplicity. It's a great product that many people need. Great job :)” - Liquid

“Congrats on the amazing success of your project!! Your product is so needed in this hectic, distraction-heavy world (and it's very stylish as a bonus) so we're not at all surprised to see how much people love it (us included)! " - Svetlana Z.

“First off, I'd like to congratulate you on the HUGE success of your project, it is definitely well deserved.” - Noah D. 

“Congratulations on getting this 100%+ funded!! I look forward to getting the large & small Esington glasses. I was attracted to it partially for time management but also I've done glass blowing in the past!! Beautiful work of art!!” - Shawn M.

How it Works: The Esington Method

Above: Picture of Rudy Marsh, inventor of the Esington Glass, taken from the original 2014 Kickstarter video. Using the Esington method, Rudy was able to read 27 books, write a book, start 2 businesses, learn programming, learn basic Russian and more in the first 90 days.

The Esington Method uses the Esington Glass 25 minute timer as the timer and boils down to 3 simple steps:

  1. Turn off all distractions
  2. Turn over the glass to activate the 3 cues
  3. Work on a single task until your time runs out

The Esington glass is designed to help you develop a timeboxing habit as quickly and easily as possible.  25 minutes of work, 5 minutes of rest.  It does this by giving you three powerful cues to train your initial habit:

This unique combination of cues was designed to lower the activation energy required to form the habit.  High activation energy is the prime reason habits don’t stick (and why only 8% of people are successful in achieving their New Year's resolutions).  

Hyperfocus

The Esington Method trains your brain to go into “hyperfocus” mode (also known as "flow") when the above cues are given.  This gives you the ability to destroy procrastination with the simple action of turning over the glass.  It's the famous "Click-Whirr" phenomenon Robert Cialdinii popularized in the book Influence.

The power of the Esington Method

  1. You are setting up an ultra fast work/reward cycle.  Once the 25 minutes are up, you are filled with a sense of accomplishment and rewarded with a break.  A dopamine rush will ultimately cement the habit in place and change you fundamentally as a person.  
  2. Studies show periodic resting increases the quality, quantity and creativity of your work.
  3. You destroy what’s known as Parkinson’s law, which states that people and organizations will fill up and use all of the available time given to a particular task.  For example, if you’re told you have a week to write a report, it will likely take you an entire week to get it done. Once you implement timeboxing, since you are given so little time to “sprint”, you may finish that report in one or two sprints.

"Soft Stop"

The Esington timer has a “soft stop”.  There are no annoying bells or beeps to signal the end of your cycle.  Sometimes, your focus can take you well beyond 25 minutes, and that’s ok (especially if working on lower-energy tasks like answering emails).  You don’t want to lose a valuable train of thought.  Just be sure to rest proportionally to the energy spent working.

Why You Need the Esington Glass

If you’re not using a timeboxing system, this is the perfect way to start. The Esington Glass is simple, beautiful and will last many lifetimes. It’s time to get your life started on the right track and become somebody.

If you’re currently using a timeboxing system, you need to upgrade your timer.  Esington is beautiful, elegant and unique.  What does your current timer say about you?

If you’ve tried a timeboxing system and never got into it, it’s because the habit didn’t stick. Other methods ignore the activation energy required to cement a habit into place.  The Esington Glass is designed to lower that threshold to the minimum amount.  It’s a physical object with a unique sound, feel and look. The value it brings is similar to a quality gold pen for a writer.

The Design Process

I've gone through many generations of designs, starting with 1/2 scale models, dozens of types of fill material from high refractive index glass to copper plated silica. I settled on solid steel because of the sound and weight were exactly what I was looking for.  

I've heat cycled, stress tested and of course quality and sound checked dozens of variants and the results is what I feel to be the perfect productivity timer.

1st generation mockup. I've iterated through dozens of generations before choosing the current production-ready model.

Why Help Us?

At Esington, we believe that within each of us lies the untapped potential of a great person.  A person worthy of leaving a long-lasting legacy.  Our goal is to give you the tools you need to untap that potential.

We have the prototypes you see here.  I’ve been using them flawlessly for months.  We are asking for your help to get us to the minimum order quantity from the manufacturer.  In exchange for your pledge, we’re offering the first run for a significantly discounted price.  Click the back this project button and help us make the Esington glass a reality.

Why I Made the Esington Glass

Until about three years ago, my life was pretty uneventful.  I had a decent job, a few close friends and family, and I had my health.  My trajectory was “live in obscurity and die a nobody.” Deep down I knew I wanted more, but life was comfortable, so I put off thinking about it too much.  

Then I found the love of my life and got married.  Less than a year later, my son was born.  This woke something up inside of me that had been buried all of these years.  I now had a reason much more important than myself to become someone worth looking up to.  I needed to earn my place in the world and build a legacy my son would be proud of.  The problem was I lacked discipline and was even lazy at times.  

I read everything I could on productivity and habits.  There were three main points I came across in my research:

First, I had a strong concept of myself as a lazy, unproductive person by nature.  I thought it was just my personality - in my genes.  I realized I had to destroy that concept if I was going to get anywhere.  Everything I read pointed to there being no such thing as a lazy nature.  It was a lifetime of incorrect thinking that I had to rewrite.

Second, I had to convince myself that I deserved success.  This is a lot harder than it sounds. Getting through step one was key to this, but looking yourself in the mirror and saying “I deserve to be successful” really isn’t easy without a twinge of apprehension.  

Finally, the third step was implementing some framework around which I could build habits that would reinforce both of these ideas.  Habits that would destroy the concept of laziness being inherent and convince me that I deserved success.

This led me to the concept of a “keystone habit.”  A keystone habit is a small change in your life that results in a cascade of positive, transformative changes.  It’s like the overweight pizza delivery guy who decides to go for a walk each morning and becomes CEO of a Fortune 500 company who runs marathons.  His keystone habit was walking in the park each morning. Anyone who has turned their life around started with a keystone habit.

So how did I find my keystone habit?  Well, first I tried dozens of little habits like running or biking every day, pushups in the morning, writing every day, and many other small things. None of them stuck. None of them caused any sort of cascading effect.  Either I couldn’t get the habit to stick, or it just wasn’t the right habit to change my core.

Finally, I took the simple idea of attacking my procrastination directly with a concept called timeboxing.  With timeboxing, you allow yourself a fixed amount of time to accomplish a task.  I used a timer on my computer to give myself 25 minutes in which to work, followed by a few minutes of rest.  This felt good and I got a lot of work done in those 25 minutes, because my brain understood that it only had to work for 25 minutes, then it would get a break. Research shows that you can train yourself to get “hyperfocused” and get way more work done if you timebox in this way. Also, your work quality is better and you are more creative if you force yourself to take regular breaks like this.  

There was one big problem.  Even though I was way more productive when I used this method, I found myself not using it that often.  It felt like another case of “lazy brain”. I had spent a year going through dozens of books, making what I thought were great mental strides.  I put everything I had into trying to get better, but it seemed like I was back at square one.  I felt like maybe I really was just genetically wired to be a loser.

After a few days of sulking, I wondered if the activation energy was too high for me to form the habit. Maybe it was the timer itself! I hypothesized that I needed more physical triggers and fewer barriers (such as finding my timing program, clicking a button and then trying to refocus on the task at hand) to help the habit form.

This led me to search for a physical timer I could put on my desk.  There were timers designed specifically for this task, but they were all cheap, plastic, noisy devices.  Plus, they were designed for a "hard stop".  They all had disruptive noises when it was time to quit.  Sometimes I was in the zone and didn't want that terrible intrusion.

I wanted something that I looked forward to holding in my hand.  A work of art I could be proud of, and something that subtly hinted that it was time to begin the 25 minute habit cycle.  I searched far and wide, but simply could not find anything affordable that fit the bill.  So I made my own.

My goal for the Esington glass was to create a timer that made forming the timeboxing habit as easy as possible.  I wanted to lower the activation energy to the smallest possible amount.  It’s a beautiful handblown piece of art.  You want to hold it, you are proud to keep it on your desk.  It is stunning.  When you turn it over, you are greeted with beautiful white noise as the steel nanospheres bounce off the glass in every direction.  This is an amazingly effective signal to your brain that it’s time to get things done.  It’s a subtle change over a regular hourglass, but it’s amazingly effective.  With the prototype, which I use every day, I formed the habit within a week.  It’s specifically designed for the job.

The change to my life has been dramatic.  I have always considered myself a laid-back, procrastinating slacker with big dreams.  Now I get more done in a day than I used to in a week.  This is not an exaggeration. Here are some things I’ve done in the last 90 days with this habit in place:

  • Learned how to code in PHP and launched 3 separate software companies - I’m not a programmer and have no formal training.
  • Created two business partnerships in foreign markets and learned basic Russian
  • Wrote a research heavy health book, the first book I ever wrote
  • Created and launched my first Kickstarter
  • Read 27 books

I didn’t change my diet or take any drugs.  I’m actually drinking less coffee than I was 90 days ago.  How does that compare to the 90 day period before I created this habit?  Honestly, I don’t really remember doing much other than going to work and coming home tired.  I don’t even remember reading a single book. The change to my life was truly transformative.

Thank you for letting me share my story with you.  I feel grateful to have found a tool that has helped me become the person I knew I could become. I sincerely hope the Esington glass changes your life for the better in the same way.

Risks and challenges

We have the prototypes ready and have lined up a primary and secondary manufacturer. The process for creating the glass are new to the industry, so the large-scale yield has yet to be tested. We believe that our exhaustive experimentation will pay off and that we will meet the above timeline. In the event the yield is lower than expected due to the complicated and artisan-heavy work, shipping may be delayed, but we guarantee the products will ship.

Created and launched my first Kickstarter
Read 27 books
I didn’t change my diet or take any drugs.  I’m actually drinking less coffee than I was 90 days ago.  How does that compare to the 90 day period before I created this habit?  Honestly, I don’t really remember doing much other than going to work and coming home tired.  I don’t even remember reading a single book. The change to my life was truly transformative.Thank you for letting me share my story with you.  I feel grateful to have found a tool that has helped me become the person I knew I could become. I sincerely hope the Esington glass changes your life for the better in the same way.Risks and challengesWe have the prototypes ready and have lined up a primary and secondary manufacturer. The process for creating the glass are new to the industry, so the large-scale yield has yet to be tested. We believe that our exhaustive experimentation will pay off and that we will meet the above timeline. In the event the yield is lower than expected due to the complicated and artisan-heavy work, shipping may be delayed, but we guarantee the products will ship.

story:
People Prefer Paper

Why is it that even in the digital age, so many Students, Editors, Artists, Business People, Doctors and Lawyers would rather print out dozens of pages in order to write on them? No one likes killing trees, but most of us just simply do our best thinking on paper.

People Prefer Paper. It just feels right. It is how we learned to be productive in school, and it is how our minds enter a creative space that is free from distraction. This is ever more the case now when Netflix and Youtube apps are a finger-length away from productivity applications.

Easy to Use

Check out this video for a quick overview of the MobiScribe!


 
 

The Best Ideas are Written.


 

 

 

The MobiScribe recreates the sanctuary of thought that is true paper so you can think your best. Writing and reading with the Mobiscribe feels and reads like true pen-to-paper, and yet also provides the efficiency of technology, allowing for easy note-sharing and access. And better yet, (yes we said better) the technology is naturally opposed to video applications, allowing the true professional to focus on read and written work.   
                                         


 

We at TeamUC want to help the world see that the MobiScribe is the true future of paper productivity. Our goal is more than just bringing a product to market, but to show the world that E-Ink is not just a technology, but a lifestyle, and an affordable one, at that!

The MobiScribe1 is now READY-TO-SHIP and comes with a year-long WARRANTY.

Features at a Glance

Writing just feels good. With an extraordinary screen refresh rate, writing is virtually instant, and as responsive as true pen to paper. The stylus drags across the screen, giving a satisfying and soft, paper-like feedback.                                                                                                                                     

Your pen stroke grows as you press more firmly on the screen. Write in pencil, ink pen, or marker styles that are pressure-sensitive to 4096 degrees of sensitivity. This degree of variety and tactile control is certain to please even the most demanding artists and note-takers.

Palm rejection ensures that your writing is uninterrupted. The Screen is both capacitative for touch-control of menus, and uses a WACOM screen (with 4096 degrees of pressure sensitivity) for precise stylus control. The two screens work together to reject your palm while writing so that you make no accidental controls while writing.  


Flip your "pencil" and use your "eraser" for any mistakes! An active, and yet battery-free stylus head allows for instant interactive and responsive erasing of text. The software tracks your writing, stroke by stroke, and "erases" them on contact with the top of the stylus.


A built in frontlight and external front light button allows usage in the dark with a simple press! Take notes in even the darkest of meeting rooms and conferences, using the adjustable brightness to prevent an obnoxious glow! The frontlight is evenly distributed, providing an even glow with no dark spots. 

 

Note taking, Sketching, Reading and Editing Never Felt so Good.

Light Like Paper. Reads like paper. Writes like Paper.


 

Weighing only 8oz with a 6.8" screen, take the MobiScribe anywhere that you could a notepad,  and easily hold it in the palm of your hand. 

E-Ink technology only consumes power when lines are drawn. A note can even be left open for hours so you can organically add more content with no interruptions! 

 

The Reader App

The Integrated E-Reader App (HomeReader3) supports .mobi (amazon's default format), .epub (the most common e-Book format), .pdf, .txt, azw3, .azw, .fb2, .prc and more!

.cbz and .cbr formats (for comics) are compatible after installing the "FBreader comic book plug in" from apkpure.com. Also the .djvu format can be read using djvu reader app on apkpure.com

Please inquire if you have a more esoteric format you would like us to verify! The Android OS also allows for you to install other common e-reader apps such as the Kindle app, Kobo reader, moon reader, scribd reader, and more, so if you have a collection saved on their cloud you can access it after installing their app. 

(Not all android apps can be installed and may not all work as originally intended but reader apps have been the most consistently compatible due to the consistent hardware expectations!) 

 

The Note App

No more Notebooks. No more Sticky Notes. No more Lost Paper Scraps.

 

Preset Backgrounds for all Occasions

Never carry around 5 different notebooks again!

Preset backgrounds allow for taking notes on... a narrow ruled template, college ruled template, Cornell note template, graph paper template, sheet music template, and more! All of these can be natively exported as a .pdf or .png and then shared.

All markings are kept if you close the note to work on another project. Just like a real notebook, your changes will still be there when you go back to your note; except you can also make a copy instantly to share with colleagues!

 

Glare-Free Screen

A Screen that's truly easy-on-the-eyes. No glare, No eyestrain.  

The E-Ink Screen is entirely glare-free in direct sunlight, just like paper. Not only is it easy-on-the-eyes and a pleasure to look at, but it is also suited for long periods of usage,  preventing eyestrain. Look forward to meetings or work sessions under bright lights, near windows, and outdoors, with text displayed in high definition 1440x1080 pixels.

 

Adjustable Front-light 

 

 

Wi-fi

The Mobiscribe also retains Wifi connectivity and native browser. The screen is incompatible with video, helping you keep focused on documents and productivity.

 

Hardware Specifications

Freescale i.MX6 Processor@1GHz , 265 DPI Screen. Front light with warm/cold glow. 

Charge via Micro USB Slot.

132mmx 175mmx9.8mm,Weighs 8oz

 1GB of ram, and 8GB of internal storage (2GB accessible fits 6000 books), Expandable with 32GB Micro-SD Card.  

3.7V 1500mAH Li-polymer battery.

ePaper Technology

 

ePaper Characteristics 

 

 

Accompanied by a Protective Case Accessory

The Right side case is a prototype and not yet available.

Easily keep your stylus with you at all times and Protect your E-reader from dirt, grim, and scratches with the recommended and aesthetic Cover Accessory. The Right side case is a prototype and not yet available.

The current case accessory (other designs pending) consists of thin and firm shock absorbent covers which protect the device with no additional bulk. The cover is outwardly wrapped in a textured and rugged fabric that protects and contributes to overall aesthetic. The inside part of the cover is a soft and comfortable felt that also houses the built-in stylus holder, safely tucked within the case.

 

E-Ink is here to stay, and we're looking forward.

In line with our belief in E-Ink's potential, we have done the unprecedented and made one of the hallmark achievements of the MobiScribe its open API. Just Contact Us!

Whereas other companies keep their API proprietary, we believe that an open API is the key to developing even more E-Ink optimized software that will satisfy the future needs for this emerging market.

The operating system is a branch off of the most stable android build and should continually expect further software development as we develop our product line. We develop independently of google, so their updates should never brick your device. 

This consistent build of android is critical to minimizing complications for open development environment, as it allows for development to occur without constantly keeping pace with Google's development of android.  

The MobiScribe runs android, and is compatible with many popular android apps, which may be installed via the file explorer. .apk's may be obtained from websites such as apkpure.com via the onboard web browser or uploaded from the PC. 

(Not all android apps can be installed and may not all work as originally intended but reader apps have been the most consistently compatible due to the consistent hardware expectations!) 

 

Your Package, and How You're Getting It.

 

Mobiscribe Box: Includes MobiScribe, Stylus, 3x Stylus tips, USB cable. Quick Start Guide with Warrantee

Mobiscribe Cover Box: Cover

Extra Stylus Package: Stylus

 

Meet the Team, You See?

If you would like, please check us out on our website: http://www.teamucinc.com/

Hi, we are Team UC, and it's great to meet you! Grown in the heart of the silicon valley, we are certainly not strangers to technological innovation. Much of the team has been based in San Jose for the last 10 years, and has had experience delivering completed B2B products to well-known technology companies across the nation.

TeamUC is part of our new initiative to try and bring a truly affordable and open source, paper productivity experience to the world. If you also believe having an E-Ink Experience that is not bound by proprietary software, please join us in our campaign or introduce the MobiScribe to other like-minded people!

The MobiScribe 6.8" is now READY-TO-SHIP and comes with a year-long WARRANTY.

All of our units will ship from San Jose, CA, so your shipping time and cost will depend on your distance from us. That being said, the MobiScribe does ship internationally. Wherever you are in the world, We look forward to hearing back to you , and how much you're loving your new MobiScribe!

 

Marketing by Joopio - A partner interested in true longevity of a brand not just one off success.

story:
Tiny Forest is 10.3 acres with a tiny house, two small barns and a loafing shed, a tiny started orchard and a tiny dairy herd of one Jersey heifer, one Holstein heifer and two  Lamancha does, all completely paid for. I am a 51 year old woman who has found her calling with calves and a passion for local, sustainable agriculture that is humane and ethical and environmentally responsible. I have been involved with calves for over a decade  and have hands-on experience with all facets of calf raising, including calf losing. I am Dairy Animal Care Quality Assurance  (DACQA) certified and would some day like to receive Humane Certification though I follow the standards as much as possible even now.

The Dairy industry spits out tens of millions of calves each year. Heifers are retained on farms or transported to heifer operations for the dairy industry but the bulls, many of the heifer calves and the freemartins (a female that is twin to a male and born sterile) are either euthanized or enter the livestock market for veal and a life in a crate or feeders to live in feedlots until reaching butcher weight. Some of the calves enter the livestock market without colostrum and are almost assured death from the army of pathogens they have no immunity against. Some would survive with special care. These are the calves I would like to help. Not to put them into a sanctuary but to provide an alternative compassionate way to raise them on surrogate mothers, on grassy meadows and pastures. Young dairy cows, whether bulls, heifers or freemartins can be raised with respect and compassion on cows- not in crates.

Tiny Forest's small pasture settings are designed to allow for browsing and playing with buffer zones to filter run off  before entering any streams, gulleys or creeks . The calves will be raised on four farm nurse cows or on milk from the cows, who will also raise their own calf. The dairy industry is so large, these calves are often trucked from auction to auction, dying or spreading disease as they go. I would like to provide an alternative and compassionate path for their lives. I am asking for $45,000 to build and outfit one 20 x 30 barn, repair one existing barn, provide for fencing, a livestock trailer fitted with calf warmers, a small, used tractor that can move hay and the first year operating expenses to include the first 10 calves, 2 dairy cows, hay for the first year, milk replacer and dairy feed for the first year while the dairy herd comes into lactation and milking supplies and equipment.

Tiny Forest believes in clean water, clean air, healthy soil and ethical stewardship of our planet and all creatures. So many calves are bound for cruel deaths within a few days of birth, in trucks, in dark dirty stalls, at the hands of people who only see an economic value. Help bring agriculture back to the heart and local level: better for the animals, better for the land, better for our waters and better for us.

story:
Pregnancy in the 21st Century

As an expectant mom, what if there were 7 simple activities you could do on a daily basis to help empower you in managing your pregnancy? What if you had one place to get trusted information? What if there was a better way to use social media and technology to support you and your baby? Today pregnancy is complex; knowing what you should be doing, where trusted information can be found and, being able to communicate when and how you want support.

                          We are simplifying it for you.

                      54 million pregnancies every year

                             7 simple daily activities

                                    1 mobile app

                               Empower, Inform, and Support 

IMPORTANT UPDATE: We have had such great feedback on the app and are so confident that you will love it, we are going to offer the first 25 people a guarantee of LOVE. If in 30 days you do not LOVE this app, send back the 4 devices and we will refund your Perk $. No risk only the offer of Loving it.

The Story: How DoulaRoom Can Empower, Inform, and Support

When you watched our first video above you saw the excitement of the announcement at the cafe, this video continues the story. We had some fun with the scene where four fathers are trying to figure out how they can be more supportive.

(In all our videos we did not use actors, we chose to have real people with real experience. The videos will not win an Academy Award but we thank our brave friends and family for sharing in the passion.)


Imagine designing a better way to support pregnant women around the world. Is there a more important population to focus on? Working together, we believe we can improve the lives of pregnant women everywhere!

We are already in pilot but we need your help and feedback to continue improving and expanding.

Today women around the world in developed and developing countries begin one of the most important times of their lives with an initial excitement, which often turns into fear and uncertainty. There is no other time in any person’s life where an individual is so unselfishly focused on doing the right things to support someone else. An expectant mother’s primary worries and concerns are to do the right things to support her unborn child. Today there is a wealth of information through print, web, and folk stories, but what is good information and what is bad information? Who do you trust? What if you trust the wrong source?

Our goal is to build the world’s best app to Empower, Inform and Support women worldwide during their pregnancy journey!

The Team: Meet the people working on DoulaRoom and hear their passion.

DoulaRoom is designed to provide a better way for pregnant women to be in control and empowered during their pregnancy. Not all pregnancies require medical interventions; however wouldn’t it be nice to know what some of the indicators of a healthy pregnancy are on a daily basis?

This is not about technology. This is about using technology to provide the expectant mother with trusted sources of information, as well as helping her to share that information with her circle of care, family and friends regardless of geographic boundaries.

 What are the 7 Simple Daily Activities?

1. Monitoring Weight Gain

2. Taking Blood Pressure

3. Tracking Water Intake

4. Remembering to take Vitamins

5. Recording Mother’s Activity

6. Listening to Baby’s Heart Beat and noting Activity

7. Logbook recording of Discomforts Felt and concerns

Why are they so Important?

Here is Julia to explain why these 7 simple daily activities are important to you and how DoulaRoom is making it easier for you. 


THE PERKS!

Empower, Inform and Support Expectant Women Globally!

Our sincere THANK YOU to everyone who joins us. First, to the expectant women and medical professionals who join us on version one of DoulaRoom, we want to be there with our current functionality to Empower, Inform and Support you. We really appreciate your feedback and by listening to you we can continue to improve DoulaRoom for future expectant women. You will be part of our success! Secondly, to those who provide help to our DoulaRoom Angel fund so together we can bring the support to women in developed and developing countries that cannot afford the benefits of DoulaRoom.

1) DoulaRoom Angel fund

We take our responsibility to help others seriously. In developing and developed countries there are women who will not be able to have access to the benefits of DoulaRoom without your help. When you join this perk to the DoulaRoom Angel Fund,  100% of the money will go toward helping an expectant mother in need. Your name, or person you specify will be posted as a Bronze Angel, Silver Angel, or Gold Angel supporter on our DoulaRoom.com website.

2) DoulaRoom Mom Flex Option 

The DoulaRoom App and your choice of any 1 device 


DoulaRoom Mom Flex Option. Get the app, one of the DoulaRoom devices of your choosing:  1) Wireless Weight Scale, 2) Wireless Blood Pressure Monitor, 3) Wireless Activity Bracelet, 4) Fetal Doppler to record the sound and heart rate of your baby’s heart beat, and everyone will get your name, or person you specify will be posted as a Bronze Angel supporter on DoulaRoom.com 

3) DoulaRoom Mom Bundle  

The DoulaRoom App and all 4 devices

The DoulaRoom Mom Bundle. 1) The DoulaRoom app, 2) Wireless Weight Scale, 3) Wireless Blood Pressure Monitor, 4) Wireless Activity Bracelet, 5) Fetal Doppler to record the sound and heart rate of your baby’s heart beat, 6) Your name, or person you specify will be posted as a Silver Angel supporter on our DoulaRoom.com website.

4) Lets Explore a Partnership / Sponsorship / Cross Promotion Opportunity Together!

Our DoulaRoom team would like to explore partnership, sponsorship, cross promotion opportunities with medical, government, church and community groups, corporate organizations, or mobile carriers to develop a win-win-win relationship. 

  • Win 1 – expand support to expectant women everywhere 
  • Win 2 – benefits to your organization 
  • Win 3 – expansion of our DoulaRoom app globally 

We are very focused on where we are going but everyone needs help. We would like to partner with organizations that want to help us expand DoulaRoom. Our idea is to open discussion with like-minded organizations and if we come to an agreement we will use the perk money to kick it off. If we can not create a win-win-win agreement lets do some good together and the perk money to fund expectant women in need with the DoulaRoom Angel fund.

5) DoulaRoom Medical Provider App & Expectant Mom Bundles

This perk is for doctors, midwives, midlevel providers, hospitals, and clinics who want to try the DoulaRoom provider app with an iPad configured to the specified quantity of Expectant Mom Bundles (each bundle includes all 4 devices plus the app).

These perks includes:

1.The DoulaRoom Medical Provider App

2.The DoulaRoom Mom App

3. Apple iPad for the Medical Provider App

4. Select either 10 or 25 of the Mom Bundles

5. Five hours of concierge support

6.Your organization posted on DoulaRoom.com as a supporter

of “Medical Providers That Care”


Why are the 7 Simple Daily Activities Important to Mom & Baby?

1. Monitoring Weight Gain

Eating for Two? Current studies show that too much weight gain during pregnancy could be dangerous to the mother and baby. Too little weight gain can also be harmful. WOW! Do you know what your optimal weight gain is week by week? How do you track it? The DoulaRoom app and wireless scale will chart your progress daily.

2. Taking Blood Pressure

Under Pressure? So if you have never had a problem with blood pressure why worry now? Many women start out with normal blood pressure but then have it rise during pregnancy. Increased blood pressure could lead to decreased oxygen to the placenta and to the baby, which could lead to decreased growth of the baby and decreased brain development. The DoulaRoom app and wireless blood pressure monitor helps you track and record your blood pressure daily or as recommended by your medical professional. We are making it easy for you and saving you time. 

3. Tracking Water Intake

Cheers! Most studies and experts agree that expectant moms should drink 6-8 glasses of water a day. Why? Too little water could lead to blood clots or urinary track infections. Later in pregnancy it could lead to uterine irritability and false labor. It is also very important for women experiencing nausea to have adequate water intake. DoulaRoom makes it easy for you to track your daily water intake.

4. Remembering to take Vitamins

Who can remember? Under a physician’s direction there are three main supplements which are commonly recommended. A prenatal vitamin is a general dietary supplement, which helps baby’s over all development. Folic acid is important early in pregnancy for the prevention of neural tube defects. Iron levels in pregnancy are important to ensure adequate oxygen levels in the blood to support baby’s growth & development. DoulaRoom helps you track and remember to take the supplements recommended by your health care provider.

5. Recording Mother’s Activity

Give me credit! Activity is an important part of a normal pregnancy. Studies have shown that too little activity can lead to unhealthy weight gain during pregnancy, which may contribute to post partum depression. 10,000 steps a day is a goal for everyone, however who has time to count and record their steps? The DoulaRoom app and activity bracelet will track your steps automatically.

6. Listening to Baby’s Heart Beat and noting Activity

Who kicked me? Moms usually start becoming aware of baby’s movement between 18-22 weeks and from this point moms should be aware of baby’s movement at least once a day. At 36 weeks till delivery it is important to track the baby’s kick counts daily. Kick counts involve tracking baby moving 10 times in 2 hours once a day.The DoulaRoom app helps remind you and record this activity.

Baby’s Heart Beat

Here is the WOW factor! Every mom is different but it is normal from 12 -14 weeks to be able to hear your baby’s heart beat. Today this happens during prenatal visits. Now with the DoulaRoom app and fetal doppler it is possible to hear, record and share the sound of your baby with family and friends regardless of geographic distance.

7. Logbook recording of Discomforts Felt and concerns 

How many more weeks? Minor discomforts are a normal part of pregnancy. The majority do not cause short or long term problems but it is important to know what you can do and take for normal discomforts. Knowing what is normal and when to seek medical advice is critical. DoulaRoom helps you track your symptoms and directs you to some of the top authoritative sources of information. It is important to consult with your medical provider about any concerns you may have.


Mothers have spoken … 

By listening to expectant mothers like you, we have already included additional features to Empower, Inform and Support you during your pregnancy.  


The Impact!

The expectant mother is the center of her circle of care! DoulaRoom lets the mother decide who she shares her information with. She can share it with her partner, parents, best friend, family, and medical team, without concern for information security or geographic distances. Imagine your mom, best friend, or sister who lives across the country or in another part of the world being able to see in real time how you are doing, know how you are feeling and hearing your baby’s heart beat. What if your partner is in the military or has to travel for work? DoulaRoom will enable them to support you and experience the pregnancy with you.

We have also created a DoulaRoom medical provider app so that your entire care team (Doctors, Nurses, Midwifes, etc.) can have, with your permission, a summarized view of your data which they can expand in greater detail to see what is happening – in real time. Our medical team is developing  customizable automated alerts in a future release.

We believe strongly in improving the world, so as we develop and grow, a percentage of our revenue will be used to help mothers in need. This includes women in developing countries as well as developed countries that may not have the resources to access support. Our team is already working on publishing a book to support women globally.

What have we built so far?

We are piloting our first version and are already working on the next.

Here is what we will deliver in the first version to our mothers and medical teams who join us in building a better world.

Version 1 of our app helps the mother track and monitor the important aspects of the pregnancy that we have described.  Our team has worked very hard to ensure we are helping to track and provide the right information for the expectant mother while making it easy to use. For weight, blood pressure, and activity we are leveraging wireless technology so that information is loaded from the DoulaRoom devices to your smart phone. The DoulaRoom app captures your baby’s heart rate and then stores the sound of the heartbeat so you can share it with others.

We are very confident that DoulaRoom will be able to improve the pregnancy journey for women. Our guiding philosophy is: 1) provide trusted and current medical information 2) leverage the best technology to make it easier 3) listen to you, so we can work together to continue to improve the app so it will be the world’s best app to empower, inform and support women worldwide during their pregnancy journey!

Our Team

How our team got here is simple; we brought together a group of diverse medical, technical and business people who are top in their fields and shared one common passion; to leave a positive imprint on the world. Our group has spent a lifetime using their unique talents to help others. Now they want to help you. 


Shipping/Handling and Taxes/Duties/Customs

Our goal at DoulaRoom is to create a global community of expectant mothers, their family and friends, and medical teams who can share and improve the pregnancy experience. We have worked really hard to reduced financial barriers with a one world global shipping cost. There is a financial risk for us but we want to be able to ship to anyone anywhere. We trust you understand that we need to reserve the option if your location shipping cost is prohibitive we will to contact you and discuss how can find a solution working together or refund your perk money. Any applicable local taxes/duties/customs have not been included in the cost and if applicable would be extra. We are registered as a Canadian based company. 

Frequently Asked Questions?

·What is a Doula?

A doula is a non medical person who provides emotional and physical support to a woman and her family before, during and after labor. The assistance of a doula is often associated with improved maternal and fetal health. A doula performs no medical duties or decision-making, deferring instead to nurses, midwives, and doctors.

·What is DoulaRoom?

DoulaRoom is a mobile app for pregnant women and their families. It provides current online resources, which empowers the expectant mother to be an active and informed collaborator in her healthcare during her pregnancy. As well, it enables her to share her physical and emotional journey with her support circle, regardless of their geographic location. DoulaRoom like a doula performs no medical duties or decision-making, deferring instead to nurses, midwives, and doctors. 

·Can DoulaRoom work with the integrated devices on iOS and Android?

DoulaRoom is designed to work on both the Android and iOS operating systems. Both phone and tablet form factors are supported. The seamless integration of the blood pressure monitor, weigh scale and activity bracelet require the phone or tablet to be compatible with BlueTooth 4.0 standards. Most current phones and tables support this. To make it easier for you we have added the link below where you can check if you are not sure. Even if your phone or tablet are of an older version we have made it so you can still input all the device information manually and still benefit from the features to Empower, Inform and Support you. 

List of Devices Supporting BlueTooth 4.0:

http://www.bluetooth.com/Pages/Bluetooth-Smart-Devices-List.aspx

What do I do with the DoulaRoom devices after I have my baby?

Your personal health is just as important to you, your family and your newborn after you deliver as it was during your pregnancy. Our medical team’s advice is to continue to using the weight scale, blood pressure monitor and activity bracelet to help manage your health. If you are not planning to have any more pregnancies you could gift or sell the fetal doppler.

·Is DoulaRoom a medical app or a technology app?

Neither. DoulaRoom is designed to provide a better way for pregnant women to be in control and empowered during their pregnancies. Not all pregnancies require medical interventions; however wouldn’t it be nice to know what the important measures like blood pressure and fetal heart rate should be on a daily basis? This is not about technology. Technology is being leveraged to keep the expectant woman informed with trusted sources of information and to help her circle of care be there to support her regardless of geographic boundaries.

·Are the devices safe for the woman and baby?

Yes, We are working directly with the manufacture to build devices to our specification that are high quality, safe, easy to integrate and use. They are all meet certification standards. 

·Does my midwife, doctor, and care team have to sign up? What if I do not want to share my information? 

The DoulaRoom app provides benefits to an expectant mom independent of her medical care team. It is the expectant mom’s choice who she wants to bring into her circle of care. If a midwife, doctor, clinic, or hospital sign up and download the DoulaRoom provider app the expectant mom can send them and invite to join her circle. Our goal is to bring together expectant mom and all her circle of care together to provide a better supporting experience.  

Why are the Perks in $US?

Our goal is to simplify every aspect of services that DoulaRoom provides. SInce we are building a global app we selected $US because: 1) it is the most global currency: 2) most of our business expenses for infrastructure and devices are in $US. For these reasons we wanted to focus our attention on building and delivering the best experience to you and not be focused on the crazy world of currency exchange.  

How can this help women in developing countries?

While most developing countries have a shortage of medical support they commonly have extensive mobile network coverage. Our goal is to work with local governments and agencies to help identify which expectant moms are at risk so they can be prioritized and the scarce medical resources are utilized where they are most in need. Preventive healthcare provides better outcomes and cost savings.

Risks and challenges

As you know we are on a mission to Empower, Inform and Support women world wide throughout their pregnancy journey. You have now heard that our company philosophy is based on three pillars: 

1) Provide trusted and current medical information

2) Leverage and integrate the best technology 

3) Listen to you, so we can work together to continue to improve the app and be the best in the world to support mothers of the world.

Let’s start with how we are dealing with the risks and challenges which could impact delivering the app on time and staying true to our philosophy.

PROVIDE THE BEST AND MOST CURRENT MEDICAL INFORMATION 
We have a team of medical professionals who have and will continue to search for the most trusted, current and above all- reliable primary sources of information and research. When we provide information in DoulaRoom we supply credit and references for further reading from the source.

LEVERAGE AND INTEGRATE THE BEST TECHNOLOGY 
The DoulaRoom app runs on Apple iOS and Google Android operating systems. We have worked directly with our devices manufacturers to build the devices, which meet our specifications of integration, quality and ease of use. The manufacturers we have partnered with are focused on the medical industry, which means they know the importance of quality. One of our early and most strategic decisions was to partner with IBM for the app development, integration and operation. This was a critical decision for DoulaRoom and we are delighted with the support and commitment we have received in this partnership. We are running our business in their cloud environment and development in their global Bluemix cloud environment with MobileFirst. This gives us the confidence for scalability, availability and privacy to take this app to the world. IBM’s “Smarter Planet” and “Made with IBM” global direction for their 400,000+ work force is supported and aligned with ours. Working with IBM we will be able to Empower, Inform and Support expectant mothers around the world. 

LISTEN TO YOU, so we can work together to continue to improve the app and be the best in the world to support expectant mothers. 
We already have the version 1 of the DoulaRoom app in pilot, but we need your help to be an early adopter to use the app and tell us how to make it better. We are very confident from our early feedback that the functionality we have in version 1 is a good beginning to empower, inform and support. BUT good is not good enough; expectant mothers need and deserve more than good! Our entire team and our partners are committed to deliver the BEST MOBILE APP to support the most important sector of our population. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can participate in our Perks, that is great and thank you, but even if you can not we would ask for your help spreading the word. If everyone who read this could tell 5 friends you will be helping us to build the best mobile app to Empower, Inform and Support pregnant mothers, their family and friends and medical providers around the world. 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP!
story_txt:
Pregnancy in the 21st CenturyAs an expectant mom, what if there were 7 simple activities you could do on a daily basis to help empower you in managing your pregnancy? What if you had one place to get trusted information? What if there was a better way to use social media and technology to support you and your baby? Today pregnancy is complex; knowing what you should be doing, where trusted information can be found and, being able to communicate when and how you want support.                          We are simplifying it for you.                      54 million pregnancies every year                             7 simple daily activities                                    1 mobile app                               Empower, Inform, and Support IMPORTANT UPDATE: We have had such great feedback on the app and are so confident that you will love it, we are going to offer the first 25 people a guarantee of LOVE. If in 30 days you do not LOVE this app, send back the 4 devices and we will refund your Perk $. No risk only the offer of Loving it.The Story: How DoulaRoom Can Empower, Inform, and SupportWhen you watched our first video above you saw the excitement of the announcement at the cafe, this video continues the story. We had some fun with the scene where four fathers are trying to figure out how they can be more supportive.(In all our videos we did not use actors, we chose to have real people with real experience. The videos will not win an Academy Award but we thank our brave friends and family for sharing in the passion.)Imagine designing a better way to support pregnant women around the world. Is there a more important population to focus on? Working together, we believe we can improve the lives of pregnant women everywhere!We are already in pilot but we need your help and feedback to continue improving and expanding.Today women around the world in developed and developing countries begin one of the most important times of their lives with an initial excitement, which often turns into fear and uncertainty. There is no other time in any person’s life where an individual is so unselfishly focused on doing the right things to support someone else. An expectant mother’s primary worries and concerns are to do the right things to support her unborn child. Today there is a wealth of information through print, web, and folk stories, but what is good information and what is bad information? Who do you trust? What if you trust the wrong source?Our goal is to build the world’s best app to Empower, Inform and Support women worldwide during their pregnancy journey!The Team: Meet the people working on DoulaRoom and hear their passion.

1. Monitoring Weight Gain
2. Taking Blood Pressure
3. Tracking Water Intake
4. Remembering to take Vitamins
5. Recording Mother’s Activity
6. Listening to Baby’s Heart Beat and noting Activity
7. Logbook recording of Discomforts Felt and concerns

THE PERKS!
Empower, Inform and Support Expectant Women Globally!
Our sincere THANK YOU to everyone who joins us. First, to the expectant women and medical professionals who join us on version one of DoulaRoom, we want to be there with our current functionality to Empower, Inform and Support you. We really appreciate your feedback and by listening to you we can continue to improve DoulaRoom for future expectant women. You will be part of our success! Secondly, to those who provide help to our DoulaRoom Angel fund so together we can bring the support to women in developed and developing countries that cannot afford the benefits of DoulaRoom.
1) DoulaRoom Angel fund
We take our responsibility to help others seriously. In developing and developed countries there are women who will not be able to have access to the benefits of DoulaRoom without your help. When you join this perk to the DoulaRoom Angel Fund,  100% of the money will go toward helping an expectant mother in need. Your name, or person you specify will be posted as a Bronze Angel, Silver Angel, or Gold Angel supporter on our DoulaRoom.com website.
2) DoulaRoom Mom Flex Option 
The DoulaRoom App and your choice of any 1 device 

DoulaRoom Mom Flex Option. Get the app, one of the DoulaRoom devices of your choosing:  1) Wireless Weight Scale, 2) Wireless Blood Pressure Monitor, 3) Wireless Activity Bracelet, 4) Fetal Doppler to record the sound and heart rate of your baby’s heart beat, and everyone will get your name, or person you specify will be posted as a Bronze Angel supporter on DoulaRoom.com 

3) DoulaRoom Mom Bundle  
The DoulaRoom App and all 4 devices
The DoulaRoom Mom Bundle. 1) The DoulaRoom app, 2) Wireless Weight Scale, 3) Wireless Blood Pressure Monitor, 4) Wireless Activity Bracelet, 5) Fetal Doppler to record the sound and heart rate of your baby’s heart beat, 6) Your name, or person you specify will be posted as a Silver Angel supporter on our DoulaRoom.com website.
4) Lets Explore a Partnership / Sponsorship / Cross Promotion Opportunity Together!
Our DoulaRoom team would like to explore partnership, sponsorship, cross promotion opportunities with medical, government, church and community groups, corporate organizations, or mobile carriers to develop a win-win-win relationship. 

Win 1 – expand support to expectant women everywhere 
Win 2 – benefits to your organization 
Win 3 – expansion of our DoulaRoom app globally 

We are very focused on where we are going but everyone needs help. We would like to partner with organizations that want to help us expand DoulaRoom. Our idea is to open discussion with like-minded organizations and if we come to an agreement we will use the perk money to kick it off. If we can not create a win-win-win agreement lets do some good together and the perk money to fund expectant women in need with the DoulaRoom Angel fund.

5) DoulaRoom Medical Provider App & Expectant Mom Bundles

This perk is for doctors, midwives, midlevel providers, hospitals, and clinics who want to try the DoulaRoom provider app with an iPad configured to the specified quantity of Expectant Mom Bundles (each bundle includes all 4 devices plus the app).
These perks includes:
1.The DoulaRoom Medical Provider App
2.The DoulaRoom Mom App
3. Apple iPad for the Medical Provider App

When we provide information in DoulaRoom we supply credit and references for further reading from the source.
LEVERAGE AND INTEGRATE THE BEST TECHNOLOGY The DoulaRoom app runs on Apple iOS and Google Android operating systems. We have worked directly with our devices manufacturers to build the devices, which meet our specifications of integration, quality and ease of use. The manufacturers we have partnered with are focused on the medical industry, which means they know the importance of quality. One of our early and most strategic decisions was to partner with IBM for the app development, integration and operation. This was a critical decision for DoulaRoom and we are delighted with the support and commitment we have received in this partnership. We are running our business in their cloud environment and development in their global Bluemix cloud environment with MobileFirst. This gives us the confidence for scalability, availability and privacy to take this app to the world. IBM’s “Smarter Planet” and “Made with IBM” global direction for their 400,000+ work force is supported and aligned with ours. Working with IBM we will be able to Empower, Inform and Support expectant mothers around the world. 
LISTEN TO YOU, so we can work together to continue to improve the app and be the best in the world to support expectant mothers. We already have the version 1 of the DoulaRoom app in pilot, but we need your help to be an early adopter to use the app and tell us how to make it better. We are very confident from our early feedback that the functionality we have in version 1 is a good beginning to empower, inform and support. BUT good is not good enough; expectant mothers need and deserve more than good! Our entire team and our partners are committed to deliver the BEST MOBILE APP to support the most important sector of our population. 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can participate in our Perks, that is great and thank you, but even if you can not we would ask for your help spreading the word. If everyone who read this could tell 5 friends you will be helping us to build the best mobile app to Empower, Inform and Support pregnant mothers, their family and friends and medical providers around the world. THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP!

story:
SPHEER is a 3D Interface Intended for Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality that keep everything you do in your digital life in a safe and easy to access location. You can rapidly find any content you shared on social media, saved files, received emails from all sources, your music and videos and the list goes on. 


In SPHEER, users interact with their data files, events, browsing history, social statuses and programs -- in a timeline format represented in on a 3-dimensional sphere. The “northern hemisphere” will represent the past, the horizon itself represents the present, and below the horizon, the future.





Who is Watson after all?
Watson was first made famous in 2009 while participating and winning at Jeopardy against the best players from the USA. It is Artificial Intelligence capable of going through enormous amounts of data every second. SPHEER makes good use of many of Watson’s best features, such as voice recognition, text to speech, data sorting, Internet research and more.

Which OS support SPHEER?
We are now working on a standalone version of SPHEER that will be natively based for  all Intel machine. At the time of release, we will offer a IOS and Android version. Currently, MacOS and Windows skins are available with most of the functionalities offered.


For more questions feel free to contact us!

Thank you so much for your support.

Your devoted SPHEER team.

story:
A Quick Summary

We're a group of one thirteen-year-old and two fourteen-year-olds going to school in Coquitlam and Surrey BC. Stefan's a digital artist, social media expert and "techy. "Alin's a digital artist and hardware expert. And Laef's a programmer, writer and social media "person."

We're working on building a website and app where people will be able to post their lost pet and other people will be able to report if they see the pet. Right now there are hundreds, probably thousands of lost pets across North America and we want to bring them home.

Though this idea has been attempted before, it has never been taken to it's full potential. For example, no one's created an app! When you hold in your hands an easy way to report the lost pet crossing the road, you'll do it!

Since this is such an important task, we want to do it right. The project is set up as a .org that will make no money, but unfortunately this means that there are many things we can't pay for. You can help get this off the ground!


Where Your Money Will Go

Since the beginning of this project, we've been paying for the development and hosting of the website ourselves. This includes $25 per month to pay for hosting. Unfortunately this hosting does not give us enough space to host the many photos of lost pets that people would upload and we don't have enough money to pay for better hosting or image hosting elsewhere.

Since this challenge came up a week ago, we've been searching around for free image hosting but none fulfill our needs. As soon as we resolved on funding it on Indiegogo, we began looking for the cheapest of the paid-for hosts for data. This brought us to Google which provides storage at $0.026 per Gigabyte per Month. Compared to many other companies that provide storage at up to $100 dollars per month for just 20GB, this is incredibly inexpensive.

Once resolving on Indiegogo, we added in a couple other things that had been nagging at us for the last few months of development but that we had not been able to pay for. After adding them all in, along with Indiegogo's 5%, we've costed the end price to be $435.07. Here are all the components, including tax, that make that up:

   •   $50 for an SSL certificate (this means that when you visit our website, your connection will be secure and safe)
   •   $15  to pay back our principal for buying us FindALostPet.org
   •   $30  ($15 each) to buy FindALostPet.com and FindALostPet.net and redirect them to the .org
   •   $300 for the website hosting for a year (right now our parents are paying for it but we want to change that)
   •   $19.35 for the image storage with Google for two years (1GB per day, 31 days per month, 24 months)
   •   5% of the total added to pay Indiegogo ($20.72)

If we don't reach our goal, we'll pay first for the image storage, then for the SSL certificate, then for the website hosting and finally for everything else.

On the other hand, if we get more than what we need, we'll use it to pay for continued use of the SSL certificate, hosting and Google storage for a couple more years, as well as for online advertising for this project.

Thank-You Perks

By creating this Indiegogo campaign, we gave ourselves another problem: What should we give to those who took time to donate when in the end we're creating a free product that we want everyone to be able to use? Well, first off is your name on the website's donors' page. The bigger your donation, the larger your name and the higher up you will be!

The top few donors will get a nice Christmas card thanking them for their help. Since we'll be paying for these out of our own pocket, we'll only be able to send out ten or so.

If you're one of the first ten or so to donate $50 or more, we can give you one of the following:

   1.   We can build a small personal, project or business website for you. Nothing on the scale of a service like Google but a few static pages with pretty much whatever content you want (nothing inappropriate though).
   2.   We can look at your website and give some design critique on user experience, visual content, text content and your social media presence. This is the one sure way to get all three of us to put something into your thank you perk because we all enjoy improving people's websites!
   3.   If you're an educator (or student lobbying your teachers for more speeches), one of our group could conference call into your school to talk about our project, programming and how students can change the world.

More About This, That and Us

Yes, we're fourteen-year-olds, so why should you trust that we'll deliver? Well, here are a couple websites we've already released:

   •   VoteVancouver.org was a polling and voter-candidate interaction website in the 25 ridings in the Lower Mainland for the 42nd Canadian General Election. We helped connect users and candidates, giving a way for people to ask questions of the people they would elect, see by-riding polling updated live and find events hosted by the candidates in their riding.
   •   TheGoodSite.org is our team's website where we collect all the cool stuff we're doing.

Both of these websites are hand-coded and hand-promoted by our team. We pour our hearts into making cool things and changing the world. And even if we can't raise the money we need, we'll still try to go ahead with it.

We've been working on this project for over two months now (and it had been an idea floating around in our heads long before). From the mock-ups created by Stefan, it has now evolved into a work in progress PHP website.

And, of course, you want to see it. Just check it out at findalostpet.org/index-f.php. You can play around with some of the buttons there but unfortunately that's not the most recent copy so the login and signup do not work. As soon as we get the money for the image hosting, we'll be releasing the final version for a beta test in the Lower Mainland (but you'll still be able to use it and get started; after all, you'll deserve it!).

If you want to watch our progress, you can check out our blog at findalostpet.org/blog. Laef tries to update it as much as possible, though often with school work and the project it's self, he doesn't get the chance.

There are a couple challenges to come, even after we set up the images. The iOS app is a bit more out of our depth and so it's a bit of a learning experience for us to build it. Getting media interested is always a big problem (we found that out the hard way with VoteVancouver). And getting people who haven't lost pets to use the app will probably be the biggest challenge but we're ready to take these challenges on.

Other Ways You Can Help Out

Launching a website like this is never easy and there are many ways you can help out. The number one way is by promoting our project to your friends, family and co-workers when it comes out and by signing up!

If you have any ideas on the project, features or how we could promote it, we would be delighted/desperate to hear them! Also, if you have any connections for us (like you work at a company that would love to help out or that we could work with), please tell us. We need some!

Please follow our progress on Twitter: @findalostpet.
