story:
Our Story

Five years ago our CEO, Bryce Watson, lived in China and had the privilege to work with families that had moved to Beijing to find a job in a factory. He spent about five months teaching their children English in schools that were technically illegal due to the students' rural status. These families were generous enough to let him into their homes and tell him stories about their work.

.

 

The Problem

Some had amazing experiences of growth and opportunity, but many told stories of abuse; working 70 hours a week with minimal benefits and wages, living in unsanitary dorms, or losing their sight due to on-the-job accidents. Bryce found that without sufficient labor laws or unions these workers had nowhere to turn. Instead, they turned to each other. A friend would tell them which factories to avoid, and which showed promise. Yet, the information was often inaccurate or incomplete because they moved every 3 - 4 months. All of that invaluable information was lost to time.

 

Our Solution

This is why Bryce and the amazing development team created Vize, an app where factory workers can build that invaluable information with their entire community. Employees can anonymously share ratings and reviews of their working conditions, so all other employees can avoid the terrible conditions described above. We’re also providing resources from local, national, and international nonprofits about workers’ rights, financial literacy, and educational opportunities. These resources give workers the information they need to improve their lives. We are currently in development, but you can find a prototype here. 

 

 

The Factories

The other key player in this system is the factory. They’re faced with pressure from their international buyers to cut costs and increase productivity. Employees end up falling through the cracks. Many factories want to improve conditions but can’t rationalize the investment. Their turnover rate is 7 – 8% of the workforce every month increasing the costs of recruiting and retraining. They pay labor agencies to find employees, but they’re expensive and inefficient because they’re pulling from a limited number of employees. This is becoming an increasing problem as more complex manufacturing such as pharmaceuticals and aerospace products are moving overseas. We want to lower these recruitment and retraining costs while finding better matches between employee and employer to bridge this new skill gap. With thousands of potential employees on our app, we’ll be able to do just that, creating a more equitable and efficient labor market.

 

Opportunity for Impact

This is an enormous opportunity for both social impact and profitable returns. There are over 290 million factory workers with smartphones around the world and over 5.5 million factories that face unsustainably high turnover rates. The timing is absolutely perfect as smartphone usage has exploded in the last 5 years in emerging markets. Companies have been slow to invest in products for these customers because they are non-traditional, making developing countries a vastly underserved market.

Our initial target market is Tijuana, Mexico. Tijuana is ideal for our product for multiple reasons. As mentioned above, nearly 95% of factory workers have smartphones and use them every day. There is also an enormous manufacturing industry in Tijuana with over 200,000 industry employees and over 3,000 factories. Our app also requires a certain degree of literacy and in Tijuana literacy is nearly universal. There is currently a large labor shortage in Tijuana, creating a strong demand for recruiting and retainment services. In addition, there are enormous labor violations as Mexico's labor unions are known as "Ghost Unions" because they are paid for by the companies and thus have the businesses' interests in mind. Lastly, having our operations be so near the United States, our team is able to make frequent flights to and from Tijuana to interact directly with our users. 

 

Product Features

Users will be able to, 

 

Businesses will be able to, 

 

User Example: On-the-job Accident

In the team's last visit to Tijuana, they met a woman named Eva that had worked at a milk packaging plant. In the four months she worked there they had forced her to work overtime without being paid, health and safety inspections had been ignored, and a box fell from the top of a scaffolding, hitting her in the eye. The injury was substantial, and would eventually leave her left eye blind. The factory refused to pay for the surgery leading to increased damage, they tried to pay her a small sum to convince her to leave without having to fire her because they knew if they fired her she had legal precedence to sue. She eventually took the payment and is still blind in her left eye today.

Had Eva been able to look up the reviews of her factory before starting, she could have avoided this all together. Even if not, she could now write a review to tell all other workers to avoid this factory at all costs. In addition, Eva could have learned from our platform that they were illegally firing her and she could sue for both the surgery and greater severance pay. We could have then connected her directly to the local nonprofit in Tijuana that provides free legal services to factory workers. Once Eva had recovered from the surgery we could provide her with free online education to improve her chances of finding a better job. While we can’t solve all of Eva’s challenges, Vize would provide a great deal of support to help her overcome these immense obstacles.

 

Timeline

We piloted the app in late May with a small group of users and received resoundingly positive feedback. Every user told us how useful our service would be for finding new jobs and importantly how willing they were to tell others about their experiences. Our CEO has decided to move to Tijuana for the next two months to manage a full launch in July and August.

We have a goal of reaching 5,000 users by December. Selling 10 business subscriptions by the end of September and at least 30 job postings a month after that. By January our goal is to sell at least 21 monthly business subscriptions. 

Our long-term goals are to launch in other Mexican cities within 12 months, including Ciudad Juarez. Once we have a stronghold in Mexico, we will most likely pursue markets in Asia with India, Vietnam, and Malaysia as top contenders. We will need to grow significantly before launching in China due to the government's aversion to open information. We also hope to provide other services, such as helping international buyers find socially responsible and trustworthy sourcing partners and help citizens in emerging markets participate in their government. 

 

Our Team

Our team has a combination of computer science and international development experience that makes us uniquely qualified to bring this product to market. More importantly, four of our six team members have substantial experience living in emerging markets including China, Cameroon, India, and Colombia. We intimately understand the problem, and we have the skill set to deliver the solution. We're big believers in accountability, so you can check out our team below. Feel free to reach out to us directly and we'll get right back to you!

 

Bryce Watson

CEO, Co-founder

Bryce had the initial idea for Vize after working in China for 8 months with factory workers in Beijing. For the last five years, he has worked with the private sector, government agencies, and nonprofits to build products and innovative business models for people in emerging markets. Now equipped with this experience he is prepared to pursue his initial passion with the rest of Vize's amazing team.

Julian Alvarez

Lead Product Manager, Co-founder

With Vize, Julian is combining the three things he enjoys most in his professional life, business, entrepreneurship and computer programming. He has built an online eBay business that has generated more than a quarter million dollars in sales. This business experience has helped him better empathize with the end user of any product and use that insight in the technical development of a wide variety of projects including as the application developer at Swyft LLC and now as the Lead Product Manager and Co-founder of Vize. 

Krit Gupta

Senior Software Developer, Co-founder

Previously the Senior Software Developer for NextSpace Technologies, and co-founder of the environmental non-profit GreenWings, Krit feels a profound connection with the issue of working conditions in emerging markets, having witnessed it throughout his adolescence while living in India. Krit will be bringing his experience of developing AI centered mobile apps and software bots to the team.

Urel Djiogan

Lead Software Developer, Co-founder

Urel’s passion for making a difference in the world is the primary driver of his work. His experiences as Lead Software Developer for the Dwight Look College of Engineering at Texas A&M, and Project Manager of the Aggie Coding Club were vital for the development of Vize, providing him with a keen understanding of technological application as well as a nuanced outlook on our online generation.

 

Where your Contributions Go

All of the money we receive from generous donors like yourself will go towards acquiring a strong foundation of initial users. Our CEO, Bryce Watson, has moved to Tijuana on his own dime and will use the money gathered here to find the best sales and marketing talent in Tijuana. The incredible development team has also decided to forgo the funds received in this campaign to ensure all of the money is used on customer acquisition. We plan that by the end of August we'll have gathered enough users to raise our seed round and use that money to expand into new markets and provide even more features for employees all over the world. 

 

FAQ

Question: Won’t factories be upset that you’re letting factory workers post complaints openly?

Answer: We have received some concerns from factories about the potential for disgruntled employees writing unhelpful reviews, so we’ve taken two approaches to solve this problem. 1.) An obsessive focus on finding and eliminating fraudulent reviews discussed further below, and 2.) creating so much value that the service is worthwhile with or without a few disgruntled comments. As long as we’re able to create value for the workers, we’ll then create value to factories that are hoping to hire them using our recruiting services.

 

Question: How do you stop fraud?

Answer: Fraud has been our priority since we started. We’ve studied other systems like Google Reviews, Yelp, and Trip Adviser to learn from their best practices and have found that the most effective method is community policing. Allow users to flag or downvote content that they believe to be inaccurate or fraudulent. We will also be using a “fingerprinting” method that only allows a single device to create a single account. A single account will only be allowed to post once every two weeks, limiting the attempts of fraudulent users to impact overall ratings. Lastly, reviews that are overly negative or overly positive are often fraudulent. We’ll use natural language processing to conduct a “sentiment analysis” which means we will see how positive and negative a post is and weight those comments lower in our ordering system. There will always be a certain amount of fraud, the key is to produce enough real content while diminishing fake content to create real value for our users.

 

Question: Do factory workers really use smartphones?

Answer: Absolutely. In Tijuana, the data shows nearly 95% of industry workers have smartphones and our own customer interviews have verified that claim. Most industry workers use their smartphones for Facebook and Whatsapp and are already very familiar with downloading and using apps.

 

Question: Since there are so many factory workers why do factories need recruiting?

Answer: The turnover rate in many emerging markets is 9 - 10% of the entire workforce every month. While there may be plenty of potential employees, they are not afraid to leave a job every 3 - 4 months. This makes recruiting and retainment an absolute priority for many factories. We’ll be able to lower those costs and increase the time an employee stays at their job due to better talent matches.

 

Question: How will you keep your users anonymous?

Answer: We understand that being open and honest about your working conditions in many emerging markets could be dangerous. Employees can be blacklisted from entire industries for speaking out. For this reason, many employees are concerned about sharing any information, with anyone. Initially, we will not collect any identifiable information. There will be no way to trace the profile an employee creates directly to an individual. Once we’ve gained the trust of workers, and they know we will keep their identity anonymous, we will allow workers to create personal profiles for work applications and gaining educational certificates.

 

Question: Are you trying to help people or make money?

Answer: Both. There's an ongoing belief that you either need to be a business that only cares about making money or a nonprofit that only cares about helping people. In reality, this distinction is rarely clear. Nonprofits often suffer from a few major flaws. They don't make enough profit, so they can't hire the most qualified people, and even if they do they can't keep them for long. This creates a very high turnover rate among nonprofit staff members and leadership. In addition, because their money often comes from donors they must focus on selling their impact to the donor to continually get funding. This means a great deal of time is spent on fundraising and finding ways to make their impact seem greater than it is rather than focusing on their beneficiaries. Alternatively, businesses must create a product their customers' value or they will go out of business. Every decision must be about how they're creating value for their customers. A business model also allows for scalability, increasing the opportunity for impact. That said, social issues often get overlooked in businesses due to the need for quarterly returns. We believe there is a way to combine these models, sell goods and make money by helping people. This will force us to constantly create value for our beneficiaries and focus on our social impact. For a more in-depth discussion of this topic, see our blog post here.
story_txt: Our StoryFive years ago our CEO, Bryce Watson, lived in China and had the privilege to work with families that had moved to Beijing to find a job in a factory. He spent about five months teaching their children English in schools that were technically illegal due to the students' rural status. These families were generous enough to let him into their homes and tell him stories about their work.. The ProblemSome had amazing experiences of growth and opportunity, but many told stories of abuse; working 70 hours a week with minimal benefits and wages, living in unsanitary dorms, or losing their sight due to on-the-job accidents. Bryce found that without sufficient labor laws or unions these workers had nowhere to turn. Instead, they turned to each other. A friend would tell them which factories to avoid, and which showed promise. Yet, the information was often inaccurate or incomplete because they moved every 3 - 4 months. All of that invaluable information was lost to time.  Our SolutionThis is why Bryce and the amazing development team created Vize, an app where factory workers can build that invaluable information with their entire community.  Employees can anonymously share ratings and reviews of their working conditions, so all other employees can avoid the terrible conditions described above. We’re also providing resources from local, national, and international nonprofits about workers’ rights, financial literacy, and educational opportunities. These resources give workers the information they need to improve their lives. We are currently in development, but you can find a prototype here.   The FactoriesThe other key player in this system is the factory. They’re faced with pressure from their international buyers to cut costs and increase productivity. Employees end up falling through the cracks. Many factories want to improve conditions but can’t rationalize the investment. Their turnover rate is 7 – 8% of the workforce every month increasing the costs of recruiting and retraining. They pay labor agencies to find employees, but they’re expensive and inefficient because they’re pulling from a limited number of employees. This is becoming an increasing problem as more complex manufacturing such as pharmaceuticals and aerospace products are moving overseas. We want to lower these recruitment and retraining costs while finding better matches between employee and employer to bridge this new skill gap. With thousands of potential employees on our app, we’ll be able to do just that, creating a more equitable and efficient labor market. Opportunity for ImpactThis is an enormous opportunity for both social impact and profitable returns. There are over 290 million factory workers with smartphones around the world and over 5.5 million factories that face unsustainably high turnover rates. The timing is absolutely perfect as smartphone usage has exploded in the last 5 years in emerging markets. Companies have been slow to invest in products for these customers because they are non-traditional, making developing countries a vastly underserved market.Our initial target market is Tijuana, Mexico. Tijuana is ideal for our product for multiple reasons. As mentioned above, nearly 95% of factory workers have smartphones and use them every day. There is also an enormous manufacturing industry in Tijuana with over 200,000 industry employees and over 3,000 factories. Our app also requires a certain degree of literacy and in Tijuana literacy is nearly universal. There is currently a large labor shortage in Tijuana, creating a strong demand for recruiting and retainment services. In addition, there are enormous labor violations as Mexico's labor unions are known as "Ghost Unions" because they are paid for by the companies and thus have the businesses' interests in mind. Lastly, having our operations be so near the United States, our team is able to make frequent flights to and from Tijuana to interact directly with our users.  Product FeaturesUsers will be able to,  Businesses will be able to,  User Example: On-the-job AccidentIn the team's last visit to Tijuana, they met a woman named Eva that had worked at a milk packaging plant. In the four months she worked there they had forced her to work overtime without being paid, health and safety inspections had been ignored, and a box fell from the top of a scaffolding, hitting her in the eye. The injury was substantial, and would eventually leave her left eye blind. The factory refused to pay for the surgery leading to increased damage, they tried to pay her a small sum to convince her to leave without having to fire her because they knew if they fired her she had legal precedence to sue. She eventually took the payment and is still blind in her left eye today.Had Eva been able to look up the reviews of her factory before starting, she could have avoided this all together. Even if not, she could now write a review to tell all other workers to avoid this factory at all costs. In addition, Eva could have learned from our platform that they were illegally firing her and she could sue for both the surgery and greater severance pay. We could have then connected her directly to the local nonprofit in Tijuana that provides free legal services to factory workers. Once Eva had recovered from the surgery we could provide her with free online education to improve her chances of finding a better job. While we can’t solve all of Eva’s challenges, Vize would provide a great deal of support to help her overcome these immense obstacles. TimelineWe piloted the app in late May with a small group of users and received resoundingly positive feedback. Every user told us how useful our service would be for finding new jobs and importantly how willing they were to tell others about their experiences. Our CEO has decided to move to Tijuana for the next two months to manage a full launch in July and August.We have a goal of reaching 5,000 users by December. Selling 10 business subscriptions by the end of September and at least 30 job postings a month after that. By January our goal is to sell at least 21 monthly business subscriptions.  Our long-term goals are to launch in other Mexican cities within 12 months, including Ciudad Juarez. Once we have a stronghold in Mexico, we will most likely pursue markets in Asia with India, Vietnam, and Malaysia as top contenders. We will need to grow significantly before launching in China due to the government's aversion to open information. We also hope to provide other services, such as helping international buyers find socially responsible and trustworthy sourcing partners and help citizens in emerging markets participate in their government.  Our TeamOur team has a combination of computer science and international development experience that makes us uniquely qualified to bring this product to market. More importantly, four of our six team members have substantial experience living in emerging markets including China, Cameroon, India, and Colombia. We intimately understand the problem, and we have the skill set to deliver the solution. We're big believers in accountability, so you can check out our team below. Feel free to reach out to us directly and we'll get right back to you! Bryce WatsonCEO, Co-founderBryce had the initial idea for Vize after working in China for 8 months with factory workers in Beijing. For the last five years, he has worked with the private sector, government agencies, and nonprofits to build products and innovative business models for people in emerging markets. Now equipped with this experience he is prepared to pursue his initial passion with the rest of Vize's amazing team.Julian AlvarezLead Product Manager, Co-founderWith Vize, Julian is combining the three things he enjoys most in his professional life, business, entrepreneurship and computer programming. He has built an online eBay business that has generated more than a quarter million dollars in sales. This business experience has helped him better empathize with the end user of any product and use that insight in the technical development of a wide variety of projects including as the application developer at Swyft LLC and now as the Lead Product Manager and Co-founder of Vize. Krit GuptaSenior Software Developer, Co-founderPreviously the Senior Software Developer for NextSpace Technologies, and co-founder of the environmental non-profit GreenWings, Krit feels a profound connection with the issue of working conditions in emerging markets, having witnessed it throughout his adolescence while living in India. Krit will be bringing his experience of developing AI centered mobile apps and software bots to the team.Urel DjioganLead Software Developer, Co-founderUrel’s passion for making a difference in the world is the primary driver of his work. His experiences as Lead Software Developer for the Dwight Look College of Engineering at Texas A&M, and Project Manager of the Aggie Coding Club were vital for the development of Vize, providing him with a keen understanding of technological application as well as a nuanced outlook on our online generation. Where your Contributions GoAll of the money we receive from generous donors like yourself will go towards acquiring a strong foundation of initial users. Our CEO, Bryce Watson, has moved to Tijuana on his own dime and will use the money gathered here to find the best sales and marketing talent in Tijuana. The incredible development team has also decided to forgo the funds received in this campaign to ensure all of the money is used on customer acquisition. We plan that by the end of August we'll have gathered enough users to raise our seed round and use that money to expand into new markets and provide even more features for employees all over the world.  FAQQuestion: Won’t factories be upset that you’re letting factory workers post complaints openly?Answer: We have received some concerns from factories about the potential for disgruntled employees writing unhelpful reviews, so we’ve taken two approaches to solve this problem. 1.) An obsessive focus on finding and eliminating fraudulent reviews discussed further below, and 2.) creating so much value that the service is worthwhile with or without a few disgruntled comments. As long as we’re able to create value for the workers, we’ll then create value to factories that are hoping to hire them using our recruiting services. Question: How do you stop fraud?Answer: Fraud has been our priority since we started. We’ve studied other systems like Google Reviews, Yelp, and Trip Adviser to learn from their best practices and have found that the most effective method is community policing. Allow users to flag or downvote content that they believe to be inaccurate or fraudulent. We will also be using a “fingerprinting” method that only allows a single device to create a single account. A single account will only be allowed to post once every two weeks, limiting the attempts of fraudulent users to impact overall ratings. Lastly, reviews that are overly negative or overly positive are often fraudulent. We’ll use natural language processing to conduct a “sentiment analysis” which means we will see how positive and negative a post is and weight those comments lower in our ordering system. There will always be a certain amount of fraud, the key is to produce enough real content while diminishing fake content to create real value for our users. Question: Do factory workers really use smartphones?Answer: Absolutely. In Tijuana, the data shows nearly 95% of industry workers have smartphones and our own customer interviews have verified that claim. Most industry workers use their smartphones for Facebook and Whatsapp and are already very familiar with downloading and using apps. Question: Since there are so many factory workers why do factories need recruiting?Answer: The turnover rate in many emerging markets is 9 - 10% of the entire workforce every month. While there may be plenty of potential employees, they are not afraid to leave a job every 3 - 4 months. This makes recruiting and retainment an absolute priority for many factories. We’ll be able to lower those costs and increase the time an employee stays at their job due to better talent matches. Question: How will you keep your users anonymous?Answer: We understand that being open and honest about your working conditions in many emerging markets could be dangerous. Employees can be blacklisted from entire industries for speaking out. For this reason, many employees are concerned about sharing any information, with anyone. Initially, we will not collect any identifiable information. There will be no way to trace the profile an employee creates directly to an individual. Once we’ve gained the trust of workers, and they know we will keep their identity anonymous, we will allow workers to create personal profiles for work applications and gaining educational certificates. Question: Are you trying to help people or make money?Answer: Both. There's an ongoing belief that you either need to be a business that only cares about making money or a nonprofit that only cares about helping people. In reality, this distinction is rarely clear. Nonprofits often suffer from a few major flaws. They don't make enough profit, so they can't hire the most qualified people, and even if they do they can't keep them for long. This creates a very high turnover rate among nonprofit staff members and leadership. In addition, because their money often comes from donors they must focus on selling their impact to the donor to continually get funding. This means a great deal of time is spent on fundraising and finding ways to make their impact seem greater than it is rather than focusing on their beneficiaries. Alternatively, businesses must create a product their customers' value or they will go out of business. Every decision must be about how they're creating value for their customers. A business model also allows for scalability, increasing the opportunity for impact. That said, social issues often get overlooked in businesses due to the need for quarterly returns. We believe there is a way to combine these models, sell goods and make money by helping people. This will force us to constantly create value for our beneficiaries and focus on our social impact. For a more in-depth discussion of this topic, see our blog post here.

story:
More review videos are in the making process by several tech reviewers like Uncle Jessy; itsyeboiyt; Major Hardware; Control 3D; ruiraptor; Chris Riley; Wildrosebuilds; Teaching-tech; Maker's Muse; 3D Printing Nerd and more. Let's get excited

  • Check Out The BIQU BX - Kickstarter - First Look - Chris's Basement by Chris Riley. 
  • Check Out The 3D Printing TimeLapse Compilation On The Biqu BX 3d printer OctoLapse by WildRoseBuilds.
     

 
  • Check Out The BIQU BX - Octoprint compatible 3D printer on Kickstarter by Teaching Tech. 
     
  • Check Out The BIQU BX - BIQU BX (3D Printer Kickstarter) - Unboxing & Analysis by ruiraptor.
     

 

  • Check Out The BIQU BX - 3D Printer Kickstarter - Live Build - Chris's Basement by Chris Riley. 
     

 
  • Check Out The BIQU BX Live Unboxing and First Test by Maker's Muse.  
 

 








 


 
  • Dimensional Accuracy: Score of 5
  • Fine Flow Control: Score of 5
  • Fine Negative Features: Score of 3
  • Overhangs: Score of 4
  • Bridging: Score of 5
  • XY Resonance: Score of 2.5
  • Z-axis alignment: Score of 2.5
     

Total of 26.5 out of  30 points


 

BIQU, also known as BigTreeTech, has been a respected supplier of 3D printing components for years. We are proud of our ample experience in developing industry-leading motherboard, extruder, and software kits since 2015. Although it may be the first time you have heard our name, you have likely been one of our users for a while because BIQU products play a key role in the printers commonly sold on the market--probably even the one right in your workshop.
 

For years, BIQU has been innovating new technologies and expanding product lines to develop a top-quality self-branded printer. Now we are ready to come out from behind the curtain to meet the needs of the most enthusiast hobbyists and professionals on Indiegogo. It will be wonderful to hear your insightful voices directly so that we can achieve more incredible things together. 



3D printing was originally created to satisfy the needs of niche users but lately has become accessible to a wide range of users at every skill level. At BIQU BX we believe that 3D printing should be a people’s technology and the convenience and creativity of using exclusive, customized 3D printers should be made available to everyone. This has been the mission of BIQU since day one. 



Introducing the BIQU BX Direct Extruder FDM 3D printer with the latest and most powerful BTT (BigTreeTech) motherboard and the world’s lightest 219g metal direct extruder. BX is an out-of-box-all-level-user-friendly DIY creative task achiever. From kids’ toys, skin-friendly medical articles to other practical appliances, BX serves virtually any application well with its affordability and ease of use.



  • New BX designs:

- New HDMI design

- Dual z-axis motors

- Dual z-axis support brackets 




 

  • Fastest Processing CPU – Easily Handles All Printing Tasks

BX is equipped with a powerful 32bit, 400Mhz smart control chip for faster computational processing that enables smart assistant features like auto-leveling to help amateurs achieve more successful prints, and giving pro-users the power necessary for more complex prints.​

 




  • Easy 3 Modes Control - For All Printing Needs

In addition to the Marlin and BTT touch-screen control modes. The ingenious BigTreeTech Motherboard design supports plug & print Raspberry Pi firmware expansion. Necessary parts and interconnect board are well built-in for integrating your Raspberry Pi, both RPI3 and RPI4 are supported (Raspberry Pi itself is not included in the package). BX is the world’s first laptop-free Octoprint integrated 3D Printer.  
 



 




 

  • Safety Is No.1 Priority - Print With Peace Of Mind 

The advanced BigTreeTech motherboard has added new critical functions to extend the durability and longevity of BX 3D printers, such as power failure protection, heating overload protection, and drive reverse plug protection. Truly hassle-free printing with peace-of-mind. 





 

  • Lightest Direct Extruder - For High-Performance Printing

BIQU BX is the world's lightest (219g) direct extruder even with parts cooling fan and homing stop sensors included, which is built to reduce inertia to its minimum for accuracy improvement. Its 7:1 torque transmission ratio ensures excellent printing performance. TheBX Direct Extruder is by far the top offering on the market. 



 


 
  • Smoothest Nozzle Inner Surface - No More Clogging 

The titanium alloy chassis ensures even thermal distribution and the high-quality brass nozzle is processed with high-precision finishing that results in the smoothest nozzle inner surface within Ra0.4. With more precise filament feeding and withdrawal, the BX Direct Extruder can effectively prevent clogging.




 

  • Double Precision Stepper Motor - Doubles Print Quality 

Instead of a standard 1.8° stepper motor, BIQU BX uses a 0.9° motor with twice the precision. This significantly improves fineness and accuracy in terms of print quality. 





 

  • Double Z-Axis Built For Robustness

The carbon-fiber-like aluminum profile and double Z-axis structure guarantee ultra-stable working conditions for reliable print results. You can easily assemble the stylish, out-of-box-user-friendly BX 3D printer in just 5 minutes.




  • Reserved Driver For More Functional Expansion

BX reserves driver slots for future functional expansion, such as filament breaking and blocking detection modules; Wi-Fi interface printing module; CAN bus interface.




  • Open Source Firmware - GitHub Is A Must 

BIQU BX’s firmware code is open-sourced, and new firmware code will be updated regularly on GitHub.


 

  • Innovative One HDMI Cable Connector Design 

Innovative reengineering of the connection method for extruder-to-motherboard. The One HDMI Cable design ensures stable data transmission, is easy to replace, and easy to disassemble. 




 

  • Auto-leveling Function

Bed leveling is a tricky process and failure results in useless prints. BX features an innovative true Approximate Sensor Leveling-Free Technology - this is a 3D Printer that you can trust for highly accurate results every time. 


 

  • BTT Operating System

The upgraded BTT Touch Screen operating system makes the interactive UI more concise and intuitive. Get going fast with any printing task in just a few taps.


 

  • 7 Inch HD Color Touch Screen 

BX comes with a smart touchscreen that supports 15 languages. One-touch to switch between Marlin, BTT Touch Screen & Raspberry Pi + Octoprint systems, letting you simplify the workflow of printing for users at any level.




 

  • Easy Filament Feed-In 

BIQU BX applies a direct extruder that allows a much simpler feed-in of filament. Just take the end of the filament and thread it into the extruder, without manually poking it far along the Bowden tube. The common filament of 1.75mm is applicable.




  • Weekly Print Challenge:  Share & Print!

Filament: 1.75mm TPU

Time: 02:56:18

 

 


  • Weekly Print Challenge: Pick & Print! 


​​



 




 
  • Click to check the uncompressed details:
     










A complete working BIQU BX unit will be in the box. In addition to the BX, you will also be receiving the following when supporting our campaign:





 

BIQU BX Assemble, Configure, Performe:
 


 

BIQU BX Printing In Progress - Demo - 1:
 


 

BIQU BX Printing In Progress - Demo - 2:
 



















Established in 2015, BigTree Technology Co., Ltd. specializes in the development and manufacture of 3D printers and accessories.



Our team is initially a few 3D printer DIY enthusiasts who often communicate experiences in the 3DP forum. Then Eric, the current CEO, proposed to bring our technology to the market and share a better 3D printing experience with more people like them around the world.

For 5 years, facilitated by a professional team, advanced technology, and complete equipment, Bigtree provides worldwide 3DP lovers with first-class products and services.

Now we make BIQU BX give back to all our fans and hope more of you can witness or join us in the amazing journey.

story:
My name is Darshana Lokuge, I am a Sri Lankan National and the director of SEICO Company. 

Our company is specialising in the trade of organic goods that is grown in an environmentally responsible manner. We have many successful transactions involving the export of dragon fruits, manioc and virgin coconut oil to Dubai. I am passionate about promoting the health benefits of virgin organic coconut oil. In Sri Lanka, we have a number of organic farmers whose sole income is in the growth of coconut plantations. These crops are grown free of chemicals and pesticides, which means that the water quality remains unaffected. As these plantations are in poorer rural areas it empowers those people to develop their villages – such as power and sanitation through providing a cash flow to these people. We are a socially minded company that ensures a fair supply price for our products.

We are looking to increase our operations through the export of organic coconut oil to Japan. Through this venture we are looking for a cash injection of around $75,000 US to help us set up a permanent business presence in Japan. The money will be spent in advertising and securing a market for our goods in Japan. As we are a company that refuses to offer or accept bribes, we have found it a challenge to establish ourselves in Sri Lanka – as it is the usual business practice in Sri Lanka. We are looking to set an example for others to follow, that business can be done successfully and honestly – while having people’s interests at heart.

I believe in helping those who do not have the means to help themselves. The extra investment will also allow us to support our people in Sri Lanka as we develop our poorer rural areas. 

There are always risks in the agriculture sector in Sri Lanka but the coconut plantation industry is one of the most resistant to natural events in Sri Lanka. We ensure that our suppliers are paying their workers fairly and are working in a safe in manner – with as minimum as possible impact to the environment.

As a way of saying thank you, for every donation that exceeds $50 dollars we will supply you with a free 500ml bottle of virgin organic coconut oil & 99 way's used coconut oil book.

We thank you for considering us as a possible funding candidate.

If you have any further questions please don’t hesitate to contact us at: darshana@bmpottery.com

Darshana Lokuge

As we are a company that refuses to offer or accept bribes, we have found it a challenge to establish ourselves in Sri Lanka – as it is the usual business practice in Sri Lanka. We are looking to set an example for others to follow, that business can be done successfully and honestly – while having people’s interests at heart.I believe in helping those who do not have the means to help themselves. The extra investment will also allow us to support our people in Sri Lanka as we develop our poorer rural areas. There are always risks in the agriculture sector in Sri Lanka but the coconut plantation industry is one of the most resistant to natural events in Sri Lanka. We ensure that our suppliers are paying their workers fairly and are working in a safe in manner – with as minimum as possible impact to the environment.As a way of saying thank you, for every donation that exceeds $50 dollars we will supply you with a free 500ml bottle of virgin organic coconut oil & 99 way's used coconut oil book.We thank you for considering us as a possible funding candidate.If you have any further questions please don’t hesitate to contact us at: darshana@bmpottery.comDarshana Lokuge

story:
(Please see the Update and Gallery for the latest news update)



Are you familiar with the New Uncia DLP 3D Printer? That's because we have done a successful project on Indiegogo early this year(see here) to help people know more about DLP 3D printer, and to provide a more pleasant user experience, we have upgraded our printer in aspects of both hardware and software. Now it's time for every one and schools to get involved and enjoy!


We upgraded Uncia, because we never stop pursuing its perfection. However, improvements cost us more than what it used to be, and your contributions will help us manufacture this high quality product (using only the best components) in large quantities, therefore decreasing the cost of each individual unit. Only with a rather low price, 3D printers could truly be introduced into people's home to let every one experience the delight it brings. We think it cruel to see that people's creation  couldn't be realize, limited by the price of printers.


Upgrade for Uncia

Since our last successful project, we've been gathering feedback, suggestions and of course complaints =) from all our backers through mails and forums, which are the momentum for us to improve our products and service.

Hardware

Upgraded Projector

We have replaced our previous projector with a brand new one, and it is calibrated and fully automated, with which Uncia could provide excellent stable beam and high precision with the right settings. Longer product life could be achieved too by the improvement of the system.

( See Updates for other suggested  models of the projector )

More advanced units

Body made of steel ensures your printer stay away form deformation caused by bumping. And also with absolutely secured packaging, there would be no worries about any damage to the printer. Our stepping motor is now manufactured in Germany with reliable quality, which enables Uncia to have a long-running operation. With the support from a top-level manufacturer in Taiwan, we have one of the best guide rails in the world to improve printing success rate significantly. We have also added a small equipment attached to the back to ensure the safety of electricity use.


No more consumables!

To all the users of DLP 3D printers, the most nerve-wracking problem they are facing is that some parts such as belts would easily go wrong, and these consumables situation will be put to an end. Learning from the feedback of our customers and reviews of other printer users, now we have our belts produced in Italy for you to leave all such troubles behind. 


Sofware

We use N3D Slicer & Snapshot, and they're easy to operate.  .STL files and even sliced PNG images can be processed.


Service

Noticing that all printer users have all kinds of problems during their printing, including materials, assembling, debugging, etc, we now provide more friendly service to our users. Our tech group has developed, and with more talents joining in, instant and professional support will be provided for you.

Difference from Form 1, B9Creator and FSL3D?


Size of Uncia: 350×200×700mm

Size of the package: 400×260×770mm

Weight (whole package): without projector 18.5kg

                                               with projector 20kg

Input Voltage:100-240V

Curing speed per layer: 1.5s


Our own UV resin


Our Prints


With personal modifications, Uncia User-R.Silva printed out objects at 25 microns!


Contributions we want to make with your encouragement!


With the best cost-efficiency of our printer, we believe that Uncia is most suitable for families and educational institutions. However, the concept of 3D printing is not extensively introduced to people in Asia as it is in Europe and U.S., so we feel the responsibility to spread technology to schools as apart of the 3D printing trend. After all, making technology serve every ordinary person is our ultimate goal, while helping us on this project can make it happen!

Asia schools are all welcome to visit our website to join the project!

Once $299 printers are all gone, we will donate 1 Uncia printer.

Once $599 printers are all gone, we will donate 1 Uncia printer.

Both $299 & $399 printers are gone, 5 more will be donated.

Both $599 & $699 printers are gone, 5 more will be donated.

Please Visit:

http://www.uncia3d.com/contact-us.html


Risks and Challenges

We have made improvements to Uncia, but it could be introduced to all only in large quantities, so that we are not sure if you guys could receive the upgraded Uncia at the lowest price on the market, and enjoy its perfect user experience.

If the goals on "Free Uncia for schools" can't be reached, many schools lost the opportunity to get to know 3D printing and students can't  have fun with Uncia.

FAQ

1. Q:  How could I place an order?

    A: After you made the contribution, please go visit our website and click "store". Select the "Uncia for Indiegogo funders" product. Make sure the E-mail address is the same one you use on Indiegogo, or tell us via:  uncia3d@gmail.com

www. uncia3d.com

Attention: All printers are assembled and all prices don't include freight.

2. Q:  When will you start the shipment?

    A: Delivery will start on September 1st. $399 and $699 printers first, then follows the $299 and $599. The sequence of the delivery depends on time of your orders.

3. Q: How long is the delivery period ?

    A:  If you are from Asian countries, packages are normally received in 3 workdays. If you are from North American, West European or Australia, packages are normally received in 5 workdays. Other countries, packages are normally received within a week. But it could take 2 to 3 weeks for Middle East and South Africa. 

4.Q: Do your delivery cover all countries and areas?

    A: The following countries are not covered: India, Afghanistan, Russia, Jordan, Iraq, Paraguay, Chile.

4. Q: How many payment methods do you have?

    A: You can purchase and pay on our online store with Paypal or Credit Card via Paypal. If you buy in quantity, you can wire transfer the funds directly to our bank accounts in China.

5. Q: Which suppliers' UV resins are adaptable to Uncia 3D printer?

    A: For your convenience, it is better to buy resin locally. You can purchase UV resins from Makerjuice(North America) or Spot-A-Materials(Europe), All resins that hardens with the light of wavelength around 400nm are compatible with Uncia. We could deliver resins to H.K., Taiwan and Macau, and you can arrange the shipment from there if you have the channels.

story:
MAKING TIME KEEPING EASIER

Why?

Many industries are still relying on traditional paper time sheets. Keeping track of all the paper, sending it to the office, keying it in; it's such a hassle! And most field-based systems out there suck! -or are otherwise expensive and proprietary.

Can't we just use someone's app?

Yes, and NO. Sure, there a a billion 'apps' and even some wall-mounted time clocks that connect with the cloud. But who wants to do a search through a thousand employees to select the right one, or navigate tiny buttons on small touch screens. If it isn't easier that writing your time down on a piece of paper then employees are going to resist implementing it into your business.

What we built

We use NFC (Similar to RFID but for phones) and QR Codes as a simple IN/OUT entry point for clocking employees in. A GPS snapshot can be optionally recorded at the time and data is made available to payroll admins within seconds through our cloud based platform TIMEDOCK. 

The people

We have two co-owners within the company. Le-roy Staines (Technical Director) developed the idea and product to the level that it is at now. Le-roy has 5 years experience in high-rise industrial engineering both as a labourer and moving up to project management. After that he formed a web development company DVI for nearly 5 years. After spending a year working on TIMEDOCK part time (all night long!) he closed  DVI in favour of TIMEDOCK and brought on board long-time client and business mentor Warren Coogan. A full year of double-time development then proceeded and we just launched on the 4th of March 2014! =)


Existing investment

Both directors have already contributed (collectively) over $275,000 in cash and at least twice that in time and shared resources.

Financial position

Revenue is growing steadily however costs of R&D, development, office space, parts, equipment, licenses, trademarks etc are soaring. We are moving fast but we need to move faster! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need additional funding to purchase higher volumes of components for our TimeTablet® devices (to lower costs for consumers). We are also looking to employ a second developer and potentially a sales person to really nail the leads we are generating (around $25k+ in direct-contact leads per week after 4 weeks online with very little advertising, let alone all the web sign ups).

We need a sales guru to catch those big fish who aren't comfortable with signing up online!

Your contribution

Your contribution will help us pick up the pace, lower our costs and expand more into the global market as a leading time and attendance cloud based system.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out!!!
  • Link to this page on your website!!!
  • Or you could even become a customer =)

Thank you very much for taking to time to read all of that; we really do appreciate it.

Kind regards,

Le-roy Staines (Technical Director and founder of TIMEDOCK.com, TimeTablet® and MobileTimeClock apps)

story:
http://www.indiegogo.com/SUMPODALUMINIUM



Now the first round is finished. I thank all the people who bought a SUMPOD.

I am waiting on some parts and expect the first machines to ship within the estimated lead time. I will contact when each SUMPOD is ready for dispatch.

Thanks again for your support

Richard



UPDATE 24/07/2011

The newly designed website is live at SUMPOD.COM. It has a forum for all and news posts.



UPDATE 08/07/2011

I have now started a website at SUMPOD.COM. Over the next week I will be adding videos, a blog and a forum.

What is SUMPOD?

My aim in designing the SUMPOD was to produce a product which not only makes the technology affordable and hence accessible but has the safety of the user at the forefront. That aim has been met with the SUMPOD. You may ask why a home 3d printer is necessary. My view is that like the inkjet printer which turned a lot of people into photographers and desktop publishers, a 3d printer will reignite our need to invent, design and construct with the end result being a rebirth of manufacturing. Anyone of any age will have the ability to have an idea and see it through from conception to manufacture. Home manufacture. It could also reduce the amount of waste by giving the user the ability to fix broken plastic parts, by designing and printing replacements.

It is not necessary to design objects as there are multitudes of designs available for free on-line which can be downloaded and printed using the available software.

BUILD QUALITY

The units are built using precision cut CNC parts using 18mm MDF, for strength, with axis which run on quality linear bearings and are driven by quality steel reinforced belts and trapezoidal spindles for smooth motion. The motors are high torque Nema 17s which are the best compromise between size, weight and power.

The extruder is based on the tried and tested wade extruder with an aluminium block hot end.

The machines will have a build area of 150mm by 150mm by 100mm with an overall size of 280*350*280.

There is a lcd display which is used to display temperature and will allow future developments such as a SD card standalone functionality.

All these components and design choices ensure that the machine will be long lasting, accurate and safe.

ACCESSORIES

A Dremel attachment for PCBs and light routing, such as lithopanes, is to be included with the kit.


PARTICIPATION

Your participation will ensure that you are one of the first to have a SUMPOD. Complete instruction on the assembly and use of the machine will be provided along with the access to a forum and site which will be unveiled at the time of the first shipments.

The SUMPODs will be made and dispatched in the order of the contributions received. The time from contribution to shipping will be between six to eight weeks.


There are THREE levels of participation:

$400+p&p :A MDF KIT excluding electronics but including motors.

$500+ p&p  :A MDF KIT including all electronics( these are of medium complexity
but use through hole components).

$600 + p&p :A MDF KIT with fully soldered electronics ready to use.

The MDF is supplied in the natural colour. This can be left as is or can be sealed and painted to reflect your individuality.


Postage costs :

You will be sent a Paypal request for the postage costs just before shipping. Please do not add these costs to the contribution. Any problem please send a message before you contribute.

Rest of World: $120
United Kingdom: $60
Pick up In Person in UK: Free ( to be arranged when order is complete)



Why IndieGoGO?

IndieGoGO contributors will not only be the first to have an affordable but quality 3D printer but will help me see the demand for such a product.

I have been asked what if the goal is not reached. The goal will allow me to take a small profit from each machine, by bulk buying but I have made sure that the price quoted is one that would ensure a machine to all participants regardless of goal. It was never my intention to make a massive profit from each machine but with success will bring a small profit ensuring that I strive for a quality product.

Why contribute?

I will be properly releasing more information to make you want to contribute in the next weeks in the form of videos, photographs and a website with blog.
At the moment this is a small project but in time I hope with your contribution and faith in the design and vision I that it expands to reach it main goal. This being to make it possible for everyone to have a 3d printer in their home, business or school.


FUTURE

There are two accessories that are to be developed in the coming months.

Dual Extruder
The electronics, which are supplied in the relevant kits, already make possible the use of an extra extruder. Two extruders give the user the possibility of using dual colours or newly developed water soluble plastics. Making possible a greater range of designs.

Drag Knife
This is used for the cutting of card and vinyl. For example when making greeting cards.

story:
UWD -App Rhein-Main/Mittelhessen

 

Morgens klingelt dein Wecker & dann möchtest du wissen, wie das Wetter wird. Wir kleiden und verhalten uns danach. Cool wäre es doch, wenn man mit dem Wecker direkt eine kurze Info auf dem Homescreen erhält, um zu Wissen, wie das Wetter heute bei mir wird. Ihr plant einen Ausflug im Sommer & seid euch nicht sicher, ob das Wetter hält oder ob Gewitter anstehen? Dann hilft hier nur das eigen entwickelte Warnsystem vom Unwetterdienst Rhein-Main/Mittelhessen. Das Feature ermöglicht es, dass ihr unbesorgt einen Ausflug planen könnt, denn via. Einstellung erhaltet ihr frühzeitig eine Vorabinfo über mögliche Wettergefahren für euren Standort in der Region.

 

Viele weitere und interessante, und vor allem auch nutzbare Features erwarten euch in der UWD Rhein-Main/Mittelhessen App. Alles können wir nicht verraten, da mit stetigen Updates die Anwendung immer weiter ausgebaut und gefüttert wird.

Wir können aber versprechen, dass die Qualität hoch und genau ist. Mit deiner Unterstützung finanzierst du ein Projekt von zwei Schülern, die für eine große Region eine praktische App entwickeln. 

Danke an alle Unterstützer!

story:
Recently, LiDAR sensors have been widely used in various industries such as automobile, archaeology, geography, agriculture, and more. The main purpose is for making high-resolution maps.

The most common example, autonomous cars, also use LiDAR for their control and navigation systems. Unfortunately, the price of highly accurate LiDAR sensors is very high, often thousands of dollars which puts this useful technology out of reach for many.

It’s time for us, the LDROBOT Group, to disrupt this industry and make LiDAR accessible to everyone!

Using advanced technology, the TOF sensor in LD-AIR LiDAR is a highly accurate with 360° scanning range for precise scanning results every time.
 

 

  • Time of Flight Measurement​

​

 

Compared to other traditional laser scanners, LD-AIR LiDAR utilizes the Time of Flight technique to detect distance precisely within a 12 meters radius range. It emits an infrared laser forward and then the laser is reflected back into the single-photon receiving unit after encountering the target object. The gap between the time of laser emitting and receiving is the time of flight.

 

  • 360° Omnidirectional Scanning Range

​​

 

With its 360° rotation range, LD-AIR LiDAR can sense the surrounding environment with no dead corners to actualize obstacle detection and autonomously map any area.
 

  • Collects Samples 4500 Times per Second​

 

 

For sample frequency, it can measure up to 4500 samples of laser ranging per second with high rotation speed which greatly increases the mapping speed.

 

  • DIY Autonomous Robot

​

 

LD-AIR LiDAR takes your creative robot projects such as drones and self-driving cars to the next level, making them smarter and more useful. It can be practically used to sense the environment and avoid obstacles. By detecting the absolute positions of objects, it enables your drone to do autonomous mapping and navigation.
 

  • Software Support

​

For creative makers, you can use LD-AIR LiDAR in your projects with software development kits like Raspberry Pi, Arduino, Javascript, and other specialized robotic operating systems.

 

  •  Digital Art - Multimedia Interactive Projection 

 

 

Using a whiteboard or poster to present an idea or communicate with an audience is typical. But with LD-AIR LiDAR, it can be done better. LD-AIR LiDAR allows you to create a cutting-edge multimedia interactive projection on the wall, ground, large screen, or desktop which can add interest to the content and strengthen learning and communication to enhance the overall experience.
 

  • Algorithm Verification

​

 

LD-AIR LiDAR also can be used for conducting experiments that help to test the validation of an algorithm for specific purposes.

 
  • Born To Be Practical

​

 

LD-AIR LiDAR is built to serve business and research purposes that require robot navigation and obstacle avoidance. If you are a robot developer or robotic engineering researcher, this essential component makes your robots more useful and intelligent at an affordable price.

 
  • Robot ROS teaching and research

​

 
  • Home Security

​

 

Like a motion detector, LD-AIR LiDAR is able to detect motion changes in a room with high sensitivity. Because of this ability, you can use it to create a home security system that will sense anything interrupting a particular area. It can sense when someone walks through a doorway or tries to move the objects in a room, and can be used to track people’s movement.
 

 
  • Environmental Scan and 3D Mapping

​

 
  • Vacuum Robots​

 

 

Acting as ‘the eyes’ of vacuum robots, LD-AIR LiDAR is designed to be invisible and it is small enough to be completely contained within the body of the robot without any external housing. This way, vacuum robots can remain low-profile to move freely under and around furniture more easily.

 
  • Service Robots

​

 

Based on its functions of autonomous mapping and obstacle avoidance, LD-AIR LiDAR can be applied to the design of working service robots for tasks such as route setting and automatic responsive behaviors. Its mission is to make your robots more intelligent. 

 

Equipped with a brushless motor, LD-AIR LiDAR reduces the mechanical friction while operating so it runs more smoothly without loud noises. More importantly, this brushless motor provides an extended lifespan, reaching more than 10000+ hours, which is 10 times longer than other laser sensors. Therefore, it requires low maintenance and fewer replacements for any applications equipped with LD-AIR LiDAR.

 

 

  • Water & Dust Proof

 

The new bottom case design empowers LD-AIR LiDAR with water and dust resistance that allows it to run perfectly in any condition (*The surface needs to be maintained clean in actual use.).
 

  • Outdoor And Indoor Adaptability

​

 

With anti-ambient light 30 Klux resistance, it can always maintain its high-accuracy performance under any circumstances with no limitations.

 

LD-AIR LiDAR is a Ready-To-Use compliant laser sensor that is small and versatile enough to fit in any appliance.

 
  • Ultra-thin and Ultra-light

 

Certified FDA Class 1 Laser Safety Standard, LD-AIR LiDAR adopts the low-power infrared laser light as its light source and drives it by using a modulated pulse, ensuring both effectiveness and safety. Creating no harm to the eyes of humans and pets.

 
 

 

LDROBOT is a high-tech enterprise focusing on the research and development, production and global sales of robotics, artificial intelligence and related core technologies.
 

Based on independent research, development and innovation, the company builds the "central nervous system" of mobile robots through technologies such as environment reconstruction and perception, map construction and autonomous navigation, dynamic object recognition, machine learning, motion control, cloud computing and cloud services.
 

Currently, LDROBOT has more than 200 core intellectual property rights in AI and robotics technologies, with nearly 200 patents and more than 20 software applications, along with a global IP system covering the core fields of robot environment reconstruction and recognition, machine vision, deep learning and artificial intelligence.
story_txt:
Recently, LiDAR sensors have been widely used in various industries such as automobile, archaeology, geography, agriculture, and more. The main purpose is for making high-resolution maps.
The most common example, autonomous cars, also use LiDAR for their control and navigation systems. Unfortunately, the price of highly accurate LiDAR sensors is very high, often thousands of dollars which puts this useful technology out of reach for many.
It’s time for us, the LDROBOT Group, to disrupt this industry and make LiDAR accessible to everyone!

 

 
LD-AIR LiDAR offers high accuracy sensing capability TOF LiDAR sensors to everyone at an affordable price starting from $130.
Using advanced technology, the TOF sensor in LD-AIR LiDAR is a highly accurate with 360° scanning range for precise scanning results every time.

story:
More than a journal.
A game-changer. 
  
 

The human brain is thousands of years old. It is designed for one single purpose – to keep us alive.  That's where FEAR comes in. We all have it.
It is hardwired in our DNA because we NEED it to stay alive.

But, what happens when fear takes control over your narrative? 

While reflecting upon how fear was affecting our own lives, we took a close look at the science behind fear and the power of the mind.



FALSE FEAR is learned behavior.
It focuses on what could go wrong in an unknown situation.  
 
This pessimistic belief keeps us imprisoned in our comfort zone.
We experience the opposite of the placebo effect - known as the nocebo effect.  

There is good news.

 Exciting studies in neuroplasticity are showing that it is possible to train the brain into tackling and overcoming fear head-on.

Research focusing on the mind-body connection is constantly growing. 

However in our own research, we failed to find a single journal in the market that addresses fear or provided tools to deconstruct it.

And so we made the journal that we wanted to use ourselves. 


   


 

 
Featured On:
 


     The Fear Hacking Journal has been featured on sites like
TOUCH OF MODERN, GadgetFlow and more.
 


         


 More information at www.fearhackingjournal.com  
 Inquiries - keni@fearhackingjournal.com 

 
 

We set clear goals:
 

  • Create a journal that effectively addresses fear.  
  • Include simple tools that target productivity, goal setting and time mangement.
  • Keep the design minimal. 
  • Make a high-quality durable product without compromising quality.





 

Three Simple Steps. 


 

1 - Focus On The Vital 20%. 

 


2 - Fear Hacking  
 




3 - ​ Daily/Weekly/Monthly Pages





 

Blank Pages

Space to write, draw, think or anything else.





On Design 







The Pen Is Mightier than The Keyboard

   Neuroscience has explained the advantage of writing over typing
when it comes to probability of accomplishing goals.

We are convinced.

But we are also committed to being environmentally conscious.
So we decided to use only recycle paper for all our journals from day 1. 

 

 

Use Anytime Anyplace
   

 

 


Peek Inside
   
                     

 

Risks & Challenges



 

We’re a team of designers, analysts, and operational experts. We have been in business since 2015. We have done our due diligence to anticipate any obstacles that may arise.

To keep our promise to deliver the quality and time frame that we made to our backers, we selected a manufacturing located within the US. They have confirmed that the time frame to complete manufacturing will not exceed 8 weeks. 

Based on our past e-commerce experience, we anticipate being able to fulfill orders within 10 weeks of the funds release from Indiegogo.

We should note that forecasting demand may not be accurate if order volumes exceed our expectations, it might take slightly longer to fulfill orders. Since we do not intend to ever take our manufacturing overseas, any form of challenge will be resolved promptly and communicated in our updates. 

 



 

More information at www.fearhackingjournal.com 
 Inquiries - keni@fearhackingjournal.com 



THANK YOU!

story:
Home Baked is a Full Length 12" Vinyl Record, Screen Printed, Hybrid Design project generated by Graphic Design students as a part of Designer in Residence Dan Sinclair's, Senior Seminar Class (VCUarts Graphic Design Department). This multi-faceted assignment is etched with experimental soundtracks, created by 13 students, on a limited pressing of 300 records. 

This project aims to explore and provide listeners with the tangible ritual with records, but in an additionally unique way. To some degree we hope to go beyond the conventions of a purely digital market and offer the listener a way to interact with an object, as well as a story behind it that involves  students breaking the boundaries of a conventional classroom assignment. 

The project also includes a class wide branding and identity system and aesthetic, screen printed ephemera, along with publications, zines, and posters. 

Students have created a campaign to raise funds for the record pressing production, while working hard on other project components. 

To make this dream come true, we need your help!!!

You can support this rare and amazing student project by donating to our campaign. Any amount helps, large and small!!!

Don't miss out! Be a part of it!

CAMPAIGN ENDS DEC. 1st


SELECTED TRACKS FROM FULL LENGTH 12" LP...TAKE A SNEAK PEAK (LISTEN)




To successfully see this project through to its finish, our goal is to raise $1,500 with this campaign. This money is primarily to fund and support the production of the record itself and the materials we use for the perks. We, as a class, are using our own funds to get the tracks mastered to be put on the 300 records, and creating the perks by hand, that you will be rewarded for making your donation.

These perks include:

  • A hand written and screen printed Thank you Postcard, signed by all 13 members of the class
  • A set of 3 different stickers including the Home Baked record logo, and two track icons designed by the class
  • An 11x17in and a 20x30in screen printed poster designed by the class
  • A screen printed canvas tote bag with the class designed track icons
  • The physical record with digital tracks and collaborative zine included
  • The class project publication including 2 spreads designed by each student, detailing the project precess from start to finish
If we don't reach our goal of $1,500 through this campaign, we still plan to use the money we have raised, but will have to resort to printing less products, and paying out-of-pocket for what we will be able to afford.

Meet the team!



By donating, you will not only be supporting the students in this class to fulfill the potential of this project, but you will also be a part of something magical. You will help up bring these unique sounds and experiences into the world. What makes this project unique, is the way it is created from every angle imaginable, beyond just the design and music decisions. The way they are created together and inform each other is something extraordinary for both the creators and users. 


    Like we said before, any contribution helps, but if you are looking for a way to donate beyond what can be given monetarily, we appreciate any other way you may be able to help us make this happen. Here are some ideas:

    • Share our page! Please, please, please help us spread the word about Home Baked and get our project idea out there and reach others who may be interested in what we are doing. 
    • If you have access to supplies that you feel may benefit our production process like papers, screen printing ink, sticker printing, etc... donations of these supplies are also incredibly useful and appreciated. 
    • Feel free to contact any of the team members and students listed, involved in this project, to ask them directly what they may need help with. We have distributed the work that goes into this project throughout the class, so that each of us have different roles.  
    Thank you in advance for you generous support!

story:
About

 

We're glad to be back with our 3rd project, which combines our geeky nature with the desire to create products that people use every day.

The HUNT23 is a tiny, ultra-lightweight titanium flashlight that fixes to your keyring. With a flashlight on one end and a tiny pry bar on the other, they combine into one essential tool. 

 

 

Open things. Light your way. HUNT23 is a simple, helpful keyring tool that’s always there when you need it, and won’t get in the way when you don’t.

 

 

 

This idea started a few months ago while we were manufacturing HUNT22, our tiny, durable EDC titanium UV flashlight.

After using our flashlights for a while, the single function—while useful—seemed like a wasted opportunity for truly upgrading our everyday carry (EDC). Something was missing.

So we went back to the drawing board. We stripped the flashlight tool back to its absolute basics, giving it a minimalist aesthetic, and added in a few useful features that made it worth carrying around all day.

 

 

We loved the idea of having an object like a screwdriver or bottle opener with us, but the thought of attaching yet another item to our keyring was just too much. We landed on the idea of a tiny pry bar, a multi-use addition on the back end of the flashlight that could drive screws, open bottles, open lids, cut boxes—basically, could open anything we needed in our daily lives. 

We settled on a design that allows us to do more and carry less.

 

 

 

HUNT23 provides a beautiful balance between minimalist style and maximum usability, in one tiny package. Just stick it on your keychain and away you go. 

 

 

Hate walking home in the dark? Can’t find your phone? HUNT23 is always there to light your way.

HUNT23 flashlight produces 100 lumens of crystal-clear light.

 

 

Sick of looking around for a bottle opener? Got a loose screw that’s bugging you? The tiny pry bar has you sorted.  

 

Won’t damage products inside packages.

 

 

If you’re after a simple, brilliant multi-use EDC tool that’s always there when you need it, HUNT23 is the tool for you.  

 

 

HUNT23 is the toughest and smallest flashlight you've ever seen; finger-sized yet with maximum durability and the strongest light beam in any product this size. 

 

 

Testing has proven that our flashlight is virtually indestructible. It's definitely a LIFETIME use body!  

 

 

 

Light your path and find what you need with HUNT23’s brilliant white light.

 

 

The UV light option allows you to explore the hidden world. Keep safety top-of-mind and always be aware of your surroundings. Fingerprints, hidden stains, or secret messages in books will all become illuminated.

 

 

 

Materials

100% Grade 5 Titanium 

LED Specs

  • SMD LED Bulb (100 Lumens)
  • Built-in Resistor To Prevent Overheating
  • Bulb Lifespan 30,000 - 50,000 hours
  • Uses 3 Common 1.55V Watch Batteries (AG3 LR41 or 392 )
  • Alkaline Battery Life - 60 Hours (Constant Use) 

 

 

Gallery

story:
THE FIRST EVER E-INK CLOCKS 

The first ever E-Ink based desktop and wall mountable interactive frames
which can show time, motivate you with inspirational quotes, display
messages and many other first ever features.


WHAT IS AN E-INK CLOCK?

E-Ink clocks are interactive wooden frames embedded with an Electronic Paper Display module. E-Ink displays are interactive just like your tablet and are connected through bluetoth or wifi. E-Ink clocks can show time, display messages, manage tasks with calendar, update weather and the possibilities are endless.



Colors & Sizes

Available in 3 different sizes and 5 different colors, and comes in two convenient options seated frame clocks or wall mountable frame clocks. A perfect companion on your desk or a piece of art on your wall.


About Us

We are professional frame makers and we have been doing frames for nearly a decade. In order to catch up with the growing technologies and gadgets, and to make something different in what we do best, we created E-Ink Clocks.

E-Ink Clocks are very unique and when ever you look at the clock, there is something new at it. Although E-Ink displays are quite new to many of us, we wanted to give it a try and as expected, the final product is quite interesting. It is one great power saving display and goes on and on without frequent charging.

We would like to thank our Technology Partner in China who has provided the modules and has completely customized the display to suit our requirements.

We have come up this far and we hope we will move on to the next step with your support.

Thank you for your time.



Please let us know if you have any questions, comments or suggestions

Email support at support@einkclocks.net

Although all queries will be answered put on to the comments page, the easiest way to get around is to mail our support team at support@einkclocks.net

Please spread the word on your favorite social apps

For dealership enquiries please contact sales@einkclocks.net


Frequently Asked Questions

What is an E-Ink clock?
E-Ink clocks are Electronic Paper Display clocks which can show time, calendar, weather, life changing quotes and even display messages from your smart phones. Electronic Paper Displays or EPD are the same display screens used in your favorite ebook readers like Amazon Kindle.

Why EPD display?
Unlike your mobile devices which constantly require power, E-Ink displays require power only when there is a change in the screen. E-Ink’s main advantage is its ultra low power consumption.

Are there any specific models for desktop and wall mounted frames?
Yes. You can order either a seated frame or a wall mountable frame. 

Do I need to charge the device?
Yes. E-Ink clocks need charging. An usb cable is shipped along with the clock for easy charging. Unlike your mobile devices, E-Ink displays uses ultra low power and stays on for days until your next recharge.

Can I connect the clock with my Smartphone?
You can connect your clocks with your smart phones through Bluetooth. Once connected, it can display your messages on to the clock.

Can the clock sound?
E-Ink clocks have a small speaker to notify time, alarms, Quotes and messages.

Does E-Ink Clocks have battery?
Yes. E-Ink Clocks have a 1000mAh battery backup. A single charge keeps the device running for 7 days.

What colors are available?
There are 5 different colors available: White, Black, Original, Brown and Teak. Please mention your color when you back the product.

What sizes are available?
E-Ink clocks come in 3 different sizes. 5” / 6” and 7” Inch frames.

What about the warranty of the product?
We provide 1 year warranty for our E-Ink Clocks. Our dedicated support team will be glad to assist you in all ways possible. To reach support, please email to support@E-Inkclocks.com

Is this device water resistant?
No. E-Ink clocks are not water resistant.

If you still have any further questions, please write to us at support@einkclocks.net

THE FIRST EVER E-INK CLOCKS 
The first ever E-Ink based desktop and wall mountable interactive frames which can show time, motivate you with inspirational quotes, display messages and many other first ever features.

WHAT IS AN E-INK CLOCK?
E-Ink clocks are interactive wooden frames embedded with an Electronic Paper Display module. E-Ink displays are interactive just like your tablet and are connected through bluetoth or wifi. E-Ink clocks can show time, display messages, manage tasks with calendar, update weather and the possibilities are endless. 





Colors & Sizes
Available in 3 different sizes and 5 different colors, and comes in two convenient options seated frame clocks or wall mountable frame clocks. A perfect companion on your desk or a piece of art on your wall.







About UsWe are professional frame makers and we have been doing frames for nearly a decade. In order to catch up with the growing technologies and gadgets, and to make something different in what we do best, we created E-Ink Clocks. 
E-Ink Clocks are very unique and when ever you look at the clock, there is something new at it. Although E-Ink displays are quite new to many of us, we wanted to give it a try and as expected, the final product is quite interesting. It is one great power saving display and goes on and on without frequent charging. 
We would like to thank our Technology Partner in China who has provided the modules and has completely customized the display to suit our requirements.
